speaker: Rhea
text: Ugh…

speaker: Cyril
text: Hang in there, Lady Rhea

speaker: Seteth
text: She needs help! Hurry!

speaker: Manuela
text: That's a serious injury… It's a miracle that she's even alive right now. I'll do what I can, but…

speaker: Seteth
text: Five years ago, when this place fell an enormous white creature appeared on the battlefield. It was the Immaculate One... Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: She tried to save me…

speaker: Seteth
text: What? You already knew Rhea's true identity?

speaker: Byleth
text: Thinking back, I suppose so.

speaker: Seteth
text: I see. In the past the children of the goddess were all able to change their appearance, just like the Immaculate One. I lost that power long ago, but it seems Rhea has not.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're one of the children of the goddess?

speaker: Seteth
text: Is it not obvious? Flayn and I both are. We have protected Garreg Mach, and all of Fódlan, for a very long time. But now... the light of Rhea's life is on the verge of disappearing from this world. It is flickering... I do not know if she can be saved. Even if she is, I wonder if she will remain unchanged...

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor. Are you able to carry on Rhea's work. As the protector of Fódlan and as leader of the people who live here... You must defend the people. Guide them and teach them. Join their hearts and spread peace across the whole of the land.

speaker: Seteth
text: It is not as though you must become the archbishop. But Fódlan needs leadership it is up to you to govern this war-torn land.

speaker: Seteth
text: You need not reply right this moment. We will strive to heal Rhea as best we can.

speaker: Flayn
text: Perhaps it would help to seek counsel from our friends at the monastery about this matter.

speaker: Seteth
text: I agree. When your mind is made up, please speak with me. I would ask that you give me your decision in the presence of Rhea herself.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Well done, Professor. We have brought the war to a magnificent conclusion. The Empire, Alliance, and Kingdom are no more. Nor are there any factions that could blindside us and cause conflict. Now it falls to us to rule Fódlan, and bring about an era of peace and prosperity. You would be a fine choice for the first ruler of this new era. I sincerely believe that.

speaker: Byleth
text: Thank you.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: So, your heart is already set on it! Excellent! In that case, congratulations are in order.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Well, if you are unsure, what does that say about everybody else's chances?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I will follow you, Professor. I aim to be a great and respectable noble.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Congratulations on a job well done, Professor. I do hope Lady Rhea is well? Is it true what I heard? You will be taking over her post? Would that make you archbishop? Or higher still? Am I in the company of the future ruler of Fódlan?

speaker: Byleth
text: Either would be a hassle.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I agree! Imagine all that responsibility. Until now, you've always fought with all of us by your side. Bring ruler would be a much lonelier job, though I am certain you would excel.

speaker: Byleth
text: The latter. I will rule over Fódlan.

speaker: Linhardt
text: So you've already decided... Such proactive thinking is the hallmark of a good ruler.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Me? I have no interest in a leadership role. I'm happy to spend the rest of my days studying...and napping.

speaker: Caspar
text: All... RIGHT! We did it, Professor! We really gave it to 'em out there! With all the fighting and hardships, I don't know how we did it... But I'm glad we made it through together!

speaker: Byleth
text: Me too.

speaker: Caspar
text: Now all we gotta do is make you the new ruler! That's gonna be a fun coronation!

speaker: Byleth
text: It was a lot to push through.

speaker: Caspar
text: Sorry if I made your life more difficult! None of that matters anymore though, right? Now all we gotta do is make you the new ruler! That's gonna be a fun coronation!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Phew... It's all over, Professor. Though I am worried about Lady Rhea... But still, Fódlan is united, and those terrible people lurking in the dark have finally been destroyed. Looks like it's the dawn of a wonderful new era...of blissful seclusion for Bernie!

speaker: Byleth
text: That won't do.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Wh-what? Why not?! Hey, that better not be your first official decree! You're going to ask for my help again, aren't you? Oh, why?

speaker: Byleth
text: Suit yourself.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Woo-hoo! You finally did it, Bernie! Now take your reward of eternal peace and quiet!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Finally! An end to the fighting. Have you ever felt happier? I've worried that I might not live to see this day, but here we are, and everything is going to be OK, isn't it? Huh, my heart feels like it's ready to burst. I'm so full of happiness, yet I feel a sense of loss too...

speaker: Byleth
text: We did lose a lot.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Yes, we certainly did. But we managed to keep a great many things safe, as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: We protected more than we lost.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I agree. I suppose if I think of those who are gone as the people who ensured our freedom...it hurts less.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Please do what you can to keep the peace, so we never have to face such awful times again.

speaker: Petra
text: War has been ended. I will now be returning to Brigid. I hope in the new Fódlan, Brigid can be accepted with friendship. When my professor becomes the leader, I think that will have a possibility. Please, choose well.

speaker: Byleth
text: Same to you.

speaker: Petra
text: Yes. Now I must be packing.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure yet...

speaker: Petra
text: Is that the truth? I will be waiting for your decision. I will be packing while you are thinking.

speaker: Felix
text: It's over. What will you do? I heard you intend to lead.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure.

speaker: Felix
text: You shouldn't need that long to decide. Make up your mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm more interested in what you'll do.

speaker: Felix
text: Well, if you do choose to lead, I might like to work for you. But first, I'll go back to the old Faerghus territory. Where my father and my old friends once lived. I need to pay respects, put flowers on their graves.

speaker: Ashe
text: Well, it took a long while for us to get here, but we did it. The war is finally over. We've been through a lot together, haven't we? Let me just say, it's truly been an honor.

speaker: Byleth
text: The same to you.

speaker: Ashe
text: I'm flattered to hear you say do.

speaker: Byleth
text: Oh, cut it out.

speaker: Ashe
text: Hey, come on, I mean it! There's nothing to be embarrassed about!

speaker: Ashe
text: For whatever it's worth, I think you'd make a great monarch, and I'd support you every step of the way.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ah, yow! She didn't have to slap me that hard. Oh, Professor, it's you. What's up? Need something?

speaker: Byleth
text: Lover's quarrel again?

speaker: Sylvain
text: I dunno if I'd call us lovers, exactly. Not yet anyway. It's was just a dinner invite.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't need anything, but...

speaker: Sylvain
text: Heh, you worried I might cause trouble again? Nah, I just invited a girl out to dinner.

speaker: Sylvain
text: All fighting and no loving makes Sylvain a rusty boy. Well, I can get back in practice now. Peacetime is the best for love--nobody dying, nobody getting hurt...except me, apparently. If you're gonna be the ruler, you need to keep the peace going so I can catch up on my love life.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I heard a rumor that you're going to take over for Lady Rhea!

speaker: Byleth
text: It hasn't been decided.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh, so the rumor was really true? I hope you accept. I don't think there's anyone else who could do it.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's the plan.

speaker: Mercedes
text: So it's already been decided? That's very admirable of you, Professor.

speaker: Mercedes
text: You have nothing to worry about. We're here to help you if you need anything at all! We'll support you no matter what path you choose to follow!

speaker: Annette
text: Is Lady Rhea OK? She was quite weakened to start, and then she took all those heavy injuries... I don't want to imagine it, but what will happen if Lady Rhea passes away like this?

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll cross that bridge if we come to it.

speaker: Annette
text: I suppose you're right.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sure she'll be fine.

speaker: Annette
text: Yes. I'm praying every day that she'll get well as soon as possible.

speaker: Annette
text: Anyhow... You're going to be the ruler, Professor? It's so strange to think of, for some reason!

speaker: Ingrid
text: Can it really be? Are we truly at peace? To think that my days will not be spent debating war tactics and preparing for battles. It doesn't quite feel real. Now that we are finally at peace, I'm not quite sure what to do with myself.

speaker: Byleth
text: Just take it easy.

speaker: Ingrid
text: That sounds...challenging for how easy it must actually be.

speaker: Byleth
text: Maybe you should think about the future now.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Thinking of the future has never been my forte.

speaker: Ingrid
text: As long as I have a routine in place for myself, I can find contentment.

speaker: Lorenz
text: The day is ours, Professor. And this victory will ensure our names are immortalized in history. Or perhaps this is but the opening chapter in the tale they will write of our glory. After all, if you are to rule this reunited land, surely there is bound to be a place for me at your side?

speaker: Byleth
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I read your mind, didn't I? Fear not! I will not fail to rise to the occasion!

speaker: Byleth
text: Nothing's decided yet.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Is that so? It seems to me that everyone has already assumed you would take the position.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Regardless, your decision will have an impact on my future, so be sure to make it a good one!

speaker: Raphael
text: Hey, Professor! I was just thinking I might go train. I know the war's over, but that doesn't mean I can stop working my muscles!

speaker: Byleth
text: That makes sense.

speaker: Raphael
text: I'm glad you see it my way! I always knew you were a smart one!

speaker: Byleth
text: You should work on other things too.

speaker: Raphael
text: Really? I wouldn't know where to start, but...

speaker: Raphael
text: There's no harm in keeping up with my training!

speaker: Ignatz
text: After all that's happened to Lady Rhea, all of the stuff with Solon and the others, and everything that's happened with you, Professor... There's still a lot I don't understand. Please teach me, Professor--everything you know, everything you've learned.

speaker: Byleth
text: OK.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Thank you, oh thank you!

speaker: Byleth
text: If I get the chance...

speaker: Ignatz
text: If it's at all possible, I hope you'll speak about it not just to me, but to everyone else as well. I think everyone should know what happened here. If we're going to build a new, united Fódlan...that's absolutely crucial.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Those who slither in the dark will never harm anyone again. They're finally done for. Thank you, Professor. Finally, I feel some vindication for what I've gone through.

speaker: Byleth
text: No, thank you, Lysithea.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ah, Professor. Ever the modest one. I do like that aspect of you.

speaker: Byleth
text: Keep up the good work.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Uh, sure thing.

speaker: Lysithea
text: As long as I'm of use here, I'm happy to stick around, Professor.

speaker: Marianne
text: And with that, we can finally enjoy a time of peace. I'm honored to have fought by your side. Even if you haven't made plans yet, I know you'll do your best, whatever your future may hold.

speaker: Byleth
text: You've grown much stronger.

speaker: Marianne
text: If true, that's all thanks to you and our allies.

speaker: Byleth
text: You've become quite the optimist.

speaker: Marianne
text: I never would've dreamed my heart could have grown this way.

speaker: Marianne
text: Please let me know if there's anything more I can do.

speaker: Hilda
text: Hey, Professor! The war is finally, really, definitely over now, right? We're not gonna find out there was some evil shadowy figure hiding behind the subterranean guys, are we?

speaker: Byleth
text: Who knows.

speaker: Hilda
text: Well, whatever. No matter what comes, I know we can triumph in the end!

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Hilda
text: Ah, that's good! Though to be honest, there's not much that would surprise me at this point...

speaker: Hilda
text: I feel invincible! A nice perk of being your student, don't you think?

speaker: Leonie
text: Well, we both made it. And we avenged Jeralt too. Can't say it gets any better than that. You've got a lot of work ahead of you, I hear. People want you to govern, don't they?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a hassle.

speaker: Leonie
text: Yeah. Sadly, this isn't the kind of burden I can take off your hands.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's a dilemma.

speaker: Leonie
text: Well, at the end of the day, it's your decision. Just take your time. Think it through.

speaker: Leonie
text: You've got to consider it carefully, so you don't have any regrets. Whatever you choose, though, just know that I'm here for you.

speaker: Alois
text: We did it, Captain!

speaker: Leonie
text: Make sure you've got no regrets.

speaker: Alois
text: At last, the day is upon us. The captain would be pleased. Don't you think, Leonie?

speaker: Leonie
text: Definitely. And he'd be proud of the professor too.

speaker: Alois
text: It seems like our efforts have been rewarded. It was certainly a long, difficult struggle to get here.

speaker: Leonie
text: It was. Oh, Jeralt... We worked so hard for this.

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh, hello?

speaker: Alois
text: Whaaaaaah!

speaker: Leonie
text: Aaah! How long have you been standing there?!

speaker: Alois
text: Er, ahem. Whether or not you choose to succeed Lady Rhea, we will forever be by your side.

speaker: Leonie
text: Yeah. We'll be here no matter what you decide. But make sure you think it through. You don't want to have any regrets.

speaker: Seteth
text: Well? Is your mind made up?

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Seteth
text: I understand. Just know that we are applying all our power right now toward healing Rhea. You should take this opportunity to speak with everyone. I am certain it will do you good.

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes

speaker: Flayn
text: I have faith in Lady Rhea's convalescence, but even so, what she needs now is rest. And while she is recovering, somebody must watch over Fódlan. There is no one more fit to wear such a mantle than you, Professor. That is what I believe. I do not doubt the others feel the same.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Shambhala... An underground city with an entirely different lineage than the goddess? Strange phenomena, driven by a source totally alien to the Crests that we understand. Most unsettling! Could it be magic? Some manner of technology? I would like to know the truth of it all. Very much so. I want to know their history, their knowledge. Why do you suppose they chose this place to occupy?

speaker: Byleth
text: Well, I don't know.

speaker: Hanneman
text: No, I suppose you wouldn't... It seems we will have to excavate Shambhala to know more. Although, I heard you will be the Ruler here? Should I ask your permission to proceed with the dig?

speaker: Manuela
text: Life can be tough, you know? But if you've got your friends to help you through, it can be a lot easier. Maybe you butt heads sometimes...but that's OK. That's how you build bonds, right? And I've got friends, Professor. Plenty of those. It's true love that seems to have passed me by.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should relax.

speaker: Manuela
text: Relax? I'm relaxed.

speaker: Byleth
text: There's still hope.

speaker: Manuela
text: But where is my true love to be found? Where is my ray of hope?

speaker: Byleth
text: Time to give up?

speaker: Manuela
text: Yeah… I'm starting to figure that's the most realistic option.

speaker: Manuela
text: At this point, I'm just hoping you stay single too. Then at least we can share each other's misery!

speaker: Alois
text: Jeralt... We've done it. We've finally brought this creaky old ship ashore. The fight was long and bitter, but finally...I can lay down my burden.

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh, hello?

speaker: Alois
text: Whaaaaah! It's you! Don't creep up like a ghost. Next time, announce yourself. Er, ahem. Whether or not you choose to succeed Lady Rhea, I will forever be by your side. You should live your life however you want. That's what the captain would say, I think.

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea stopped the forces that threatened to destroy Fódlan. She's trying to realize her own dream of peace. Isn't that enough? Can't you let her rest? If you're the only person who's fit to replace her, you should just do it. I'm sure Lady Rhea wishes for that too, right? I can't think of anyone who's more well suited to the job.

speaker: Shamir
text: The war's finally over... I have to admit, even I got a little emotional. Rhea's condition doesn't look good. There's nothing to do now but wait. More importantly, are you serious about becoming Fódlan's new ruler?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure.

speaker: Shamir
text: It's pretty sudden. Either way, do what you think is best.

speaker: Byleth
text: I am.

speaker: Shamir
text: You made up your mind pretty quickly. Either way, do what you think is best.

speaker: Cyril
text: Professor, do you figure Lady Rhea will be OK? She will, won't she? I don't care one bit who'll succeed Lady Rhea, 'cause nobody's gonna need to. She's gonna be happy and healthy again. You'll see.

speaker: Anna
text: I can tell that things will settle down soon enough. Gotta get back to slinging wares and making moolah! And hopefully no more messes to spoil it after this...

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Say, how is the archbishop faring? The soldiers and citizens are all concerned! Just when we thought peace had finally arrived... What's to become of Fódlan?

speaker: Rhea
text: Sweet child... You have finally come... I am so happy. It does my heart well to see you here, safe and sound.

speaker: Seteth
text: Have you made your decision, professor? Thankfully, Rhea has survived her trying ordeal. However... There is no telling how much longer her light will continue to shine.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, have you decided? Will you become the next ruler of Fódlan?

speaker: Rhea
text: Before I hear your answer, I shall fulfill the promise I made to you. You will know the truth about your identity... I will hold nothing back. I... created you. And within you is the crest stone of the progenitor god... I hid the crest stone within your heart in order to revive her. Sweet child... I am sorry. I wanted to see her... see my mother... even if it meant doing that which is forbidden.

speaker: Byleth
text: What does it all mean?

speaker: Rhea
text: I thought that I could regain all I had lost, if only I could revive my mother... And so I tried to bring her back by creating a body, and then burying a crest stone within it. A young woman I created... my twelfth try after much heartache... was a failure. She grew up lacking the conscience of the progenitor God and fell in love with the captain of the Knights of Seiros. In time, she became pregnant... but she and the child were not able to survive the birth. The child she bore was not breathing, and she herself was in grave danger. The new mother pleaded with me to take the crest stone of the progenitor god from her own body and place it within the baby. If I had done nothing, both mother and child would have died. And so I granted her final wish. As she had hoped, the baby started breathing again... The new life was saved. Your life, sweet child.

speaker: Rhea
text: Well before that, I had saved Jeralt's life using the power of my blood. That means you are the child of a mother born of the progenitor God's crest stone and a father who carried my own blood. I knew, deep in my heart, that you would be capable of housing the conscience of the progenitor god. I was right... And yet, she merely gifted her power to you and then disappeared once more. My dearest wish did not come true… but here you are. You alone wield the power of the progenitor God. And now, I must ask you to use that power to save this world. You must...

speaker: Rhea
text: What... No... Arrgh!

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea?! Rhea!

speaker: Flayn
text: What is wrong? Please calm yourself, Rhea!

speaker: Rhea
text: GRAAARGH!

speaker: Seteth
text: Is the power of the crest taking over her body? Why is this happening?!

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Seteth! It's terrible! White beasts have appeared all over Garreg Mach! It's hard to believe, but there have been reports that the priests and Knights have been changing form.

speaker: Seteth
text: White beasts... Are they the ones Rhea shared her blood and stones with?

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Seteth! Demonic beasts are heading this way!

speaker: Seteth
text: They are after Rhea... Professor, our situation is dire. If we do nothing, Fódlan will be destroyed by a rampaging Immaculate One and these children of hers. There is only one way to stop this. We... we must... Damn it! We have no choice but to kill the Immaculate One... to kill Rhea!

speaker: Seteth
text: It is kept secret, but there is a certain rite that all initiates to high office in the church must undergo. In this rite, one pledges to serve the goddess and in return, receives a Crest Stone fragment and blood. The ones who have transformed alongside Rhea just now are the ones who have accepted those gifts. They will shield Rhea--the Immaculate One, I should say--with their very lives. But if we do not strike her down, Fódlan will have no future. To arms!

speaker: Seteth
text: Surrounded already, it seems. The White Beasts are those in whom Rhea's blood flows strongest. Until we get rid of them, we will not be able to so much as touch Rhea.

speaker: Caspar
text: Damn. After all that's happened...why do we have to kill Lady Rhea?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Isn't the fighting already over?! Why do we have to do this to Lady Rhea?!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The Immaculate One. We cannot afford to lose here, whoever our foe may be!

speaker: Seteth
text: Stop! Any damage to the Immaculate One will only be transferred to those beasts.

speaker: Petra
text: It is seeming that my understanding of Fódlan tradition is...insufficient. What is happening?

speaker: Seteth
text: It is too dangerous to approach her now. Capture the southern stronghold first to seal the beasts away!

speaker: Seteth
text: They're coming one by one from the southern stronghold. If we do not capture it, there will be more.

speaker: Seteth
text: Let us turn our attention to the Immaculate One.

speaker: Dorothea
text: This is it. The final battle.

speaker: The Immaculate One
text: Graaaargh!

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea?! Not even I have seen this form!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Well, that's something, isn't it? A shame we must kill her. Consider the research potential...

speaker: Seteth
text: I will inherit the pride of Nabatea. Rest in peace by Sothis's side!

speaker: Flayn
text: Rhea... How tragic. But there is no time to waste. She must be stopped!

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea... With my sword, I will put an end to your suffering.

speaker: Cyril
text: This is me, paying ya back. No matter what, I'll stop Lady Rhea!

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea! Please!

speaker: Rhea
text: You're here, Mother...

speaker: Seteth
text: It seems the preparations for our invasion of Enbarr are advancing smoothly. All has been laid out so we can move swiftly to the necessary locations. Until the time comes, please try to keep your spirits up.

speaker: Byleth
text: I understand.

speaker: Seteth
text: There is something else... I have heard that Rhea is potentially being held captive in the capital. The information could not be confirmed, nor even properly sourced, but even still... We cannot ignore the possibility. Please bear that in mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: If it's true, we'll find her.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes. We must not let anything get in the way of rescuing her.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't believe it.

speaker: Seteth
text: Do not say that. To receive any information at all is surely a boon. If it is true, we must not let anything let in the way of rescuing her.

speaker: Flayn
text: We're finally heading to Enbarr. The capital city of the Empire... So many memories there...

speaker: Caspar
text: Oh yeah? So you've been there before?

speaker: Flayn
text: Oh! Um. Yes. Though it was a very long time ago.

speaker: Caspar
text: A very long time? You must have been really young. I'm surprised you remember.

speaker: Dorothea
text: The main stage of the Mittelfrank Opera Company is in the capital... I hope no one from the opera gets swept up in the coming chaos...

speaker: Linhardt
text: There are many buildings straight out of the history books in Enbarr. I hope they remain unharmed...

speaker: Dorothea
text: You're worried about the buildings? What about the people? You're an odd one, Lin.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I am also worried about the people. I'm sure my father is in a palace in the capital.

speaker: Flayn
text: Many people reside in Enbarr, so we must take care to avoid needless casualties.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I don't think Edelgard cares much for avoiding casualties, so that's probably impossible. I bet we'll be fighting until one side or the other is completely destroyed.

speaker: Petra
text: Bernie, you should be staying away from thoughts like that. We will be defeating her with our full power. Our enemy has great strength, but we will not be losing!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I could not agree more. Remember, even if our surprise attack works, a force even greater than all of our troops combined awaits us in the capital. Zero casualties is always the goal, but we must not underestimate the situation at hand.

speaker: Flayn
text: Still, we must not hold ourselves to the same twisted morality that she does. After all, we are here to stop her, not to follow her down her dark path. We all choose to fight back. We are all in this together!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: You're right, Flayn. We've got to try our hardest!

speaker: Dorothea
text: A different path from Edelgard...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: There is no stopping her. The only way to end this is to kill her.

speaker: Petra
text: Our choice... Flayn, your words are wonderful and full of bravery.

speaker: Caspar
text: Let's go! We can't lose!

speaker: Linhardt
text: The situation is dire...and so I will do what must be done.

speaker: Flayn
text: I am certain that if we can join our strength, we can win this battle without losing a single soul!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Professor. At last, the end is nigh. I love the Empire. Part of me wants it to survive. But I know that is not reasonable. The Empire's time has come. What we need now is a mighty leader who can rebuild Fódlan and rule it as a single nation. Nonetheless, it saddens me that we will not have an Adrestian emperor...

speaker: Linhardt
text: They used to call Enbarr the city of Seiros... To assault it, together with the knights, is surreal. If Seiros were alive today, I wonder what she might make of our war... In Enbarr, there was once a Southern Church, and apparently a bishop was dispatched to it. A hundred years ago, the Southern Church became entangled in an insurrection. Until five years ago, the Empire and the church maintained a certain distance from one another.

speaker: Caspar
text: It's such a relief that we've made it this far without having to fight my father.

speaker: Byleth
text: You'll have to face him at some point.

speaker: Caspar
text: Hey, don't try and scare me!

speaker: Byleth
text: It sounds like you're scared.

speaker: Caspar
text: You bet I'm scared! The Imperial army hasn't lost a single battle with my father on the field!

speaker: Caspar
text: If he turns up as a reinforcement during the assault, we might lose. I better make peace with that.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Professor! My, um, my mother might be in the city. I don't have many good memories of her if I'm being honest, but she's dearer to me than my father. If you happen to see her, please make sure she's not caught up in all the fighting. She's only a civil servant, so hopefully she takes a cue from her Bernie and stays inside.

speaker: Dorothea
text: The whole of the capital is going to be a battleground. The city has such a long heritage... Even so, perhaps it deserves to be reduced to ashes for once. But we can't let the commonfolk get hurt. We should try to confine the damage to the noble section of town.

speaker: Petra
text: Five years ago...Edelgard said a thing to me. Brigid is a vassal of the Empire. But she also said I always have the freedom to be choosing whether I am with or not with her. I will become the ruler of Brigid. So she said I must make my own path. So now, my path and her path will be colliding.

speaker: Felix
text: The Death Knight is no ordinary knight. I will prey upon him. I will quench my blade's thirst with his blood. His focus is on fighting you, I'm sure. But mine will be the last face he sees.

speaker: Ashe
text: Those things appeared as soon as we got ourselves set up in Fort Merceus.

speaker: Sylvain
text: So Enbarr, the capital of the Empire. It's finally time. I never thought I'd live this long. It's like any battle, really--stay calm, stay focused. Don't give in to the enemy or your own fear.

speaker: Byleth
text: You seem more serious than usual.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, I'm always serious! When I'm chasing girls or preparing for battle, always serious. That's me...

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll get through this together.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Striking down the Empire is my offering to His Highness. Heh, I left the Kingdom... What am I saying?

speaker: Mercedes
text: It's been so long since I've been to the Imperial capital. I used to go to the opera there with my mother and brother. I never thought my return would be like this...

speaker: Annette
text: Enbarr... Never in my wildest dreams did I imagine I'd be returning like this. Of course, most of the nobles in the Empire make their home in the capital. In the Kingdom, all nobles live in their own domains. So if the capital is attacked, it doesn't affect them directly. What will happen to the Imperial nobles when their capital becomes a battlefield?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Once this battle is over, what will become of Faerghus and Fódlan?

speaker: Byleth
text: Peace will reign.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Peace you say? It sounds so...foreign, so unattainable. But maybe...just maybe.

speaker: Byleth
text: What would you like to see happen?

speaker: Ingrid
text: My hope is for a world of peace. A world in which this present turmoil is a thing of the past--the stuff of legends. I believe those who survive the atrocities of war have a duty to create a new, better world. So the sooner we can stamp out such turmoil, the better. We must win, Professor. There is no alternative here. I won't allow for anything else.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I have been to the Kingdom capital before, but never to the Imperial one. They say it is the biggest city in all Fódlan, so we will no doubt have many civilians to worry about. I hope we can preserve the city. If it is destroyed in the battle, the people will face hardship. I would say we should avoid the use of excessive force, but I suppose that hinges upon the Empire's terms of engagement.

speaker: Raphael
text: We're heading up to Enbarr next. I hope I make it back safe so I can tell my little sis about it! I hear they got a neat opera house there where Manuela used to perform. What was it called again?

speaker: Byleth
text: Mitreflanc Opera Company.

speaker: Raphael
text: Nah, that doesn't sound right!

speaker: Byleth
text: Mittelfrank Opera Company.

speaker: Raphael
text: Ah, that's the one!

speaker: Raphael
text: Nah, that doesn't sound right!

speaker: Raphael
text: My little sis always goes on about how much she'd like to see them perform. I know we can't see a show, but do you think we can at least see the building?

speaker: Ignatz
text: We're about to put the finishing touches on this war. I wonder how Fódlan will look without the backdrop of death and destruction. I can't wait to see it. On the other hand, I'm terrified of what the future might hold. Who knows if I'll survive the assault on the capital?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Invading the capital and smashing the Empire. I wonder if doing so could really end this war. Care to share your thoughts, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: I think it'll end the war.

speaker: Lysithia
text: You say that with such confidence. I want to believe that it's true.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't know.

speaker: Lysithia
text: Perhaps you feel similarly to me. The whole mess puts me on edge.

speaker: Lysithia
text: Although for now, better to focus my efforts on the fight at hand.

speaker: Marianne
text: So, if we win the war...will you become the ruler of Fódlan?

speaker: Byleth
text: That might be the case.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't really know.

speaker: Marianne
text: You seem unsure, so I guess anything is possible. For what it's worth, I think you'd make a good ruler. You could bring peace to the land...

speaker: Hilda
text: Fighting in the capital? Ugh! And we're fighting against Edelgard! Double ugh! But with you leading us, Professor, I know we'll win. Yeah! Wahoo! Fighting! I'm a little scared, to be honest. I'm just shouting to relieve the tension, but I'll be fine.

speaker: Leonie
text: We're finally going to the capital. This will be my chance to avenge Captain Jeralt. Once we smash the Empire, I'm sure his soul will finally be able to rest in peace.

speaker: Byleth
text: I think you're right.

speaker: Byleth
text: Who can say for sure?

speaker: Leonie
text: Monica killed Captain Jeralt for the Flame Emperor, and the Flame Emperor was Edelgard. I know that the future of all Fódlan rests on this battle. Nothing else is more important. But for me, this is personal. For Captain Jeralt's sake, I'm going to give it all I've got and more!

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea will be somewhere in the city. I wonder if she can sense us coming. If we are able to save her, then I expect you will learn many secrets that have hitherto been kept from you. Are you prepared for that?

speaker: Byleth
text: I am.

speaker: Seteth
text: Excellent

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think I'm ready yet.

speaker: Seteth
text: That is unfortunate. Well, you must become ready.

speaker: Seteth
text: The battle will soon be upon us. Let us both be at our best for what is to come.

speaker: Flayn
text: I was born in Enbarr. My mother and father met in a church there. Not too long after, I was brought into the world. I do not understand how war can happen in such a precious place. It is most regrettable.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Enbarr's streets are paved with unhappy memories, Professor. I've avoided the darned place ever since I abandoned my nobility. Swore never to return. Now here we are. To return in this manner... Well, I can't say it is something I ever imagined.

speaker: Manuela
text: In the opera, actors came and went all the time. But the people behind the scenes would stay forever. I'll bet I'd know a few of them now, even after all these years. I wonder if they've left the capital. I certainly hope so...

speaker: Alois
text: Here we are, facing the final battle with the Empire. It's been a long, difficult struggle. We have to get Lady Rhea back! And we have to crush the Empire, in the name of Captain Jeralt. I don't know what comes next. But we can sort out those details later.

speaker: Catherine
text: Looks like we're nearing the end of this struggle. I'm sure Lady Rhea is on tenterhooks waiting for me to swoop in and rescue her.

speaker: Byleth
text: Probably

speaker: Catherine
text: I was just kidding! Pay me no mind.

speaker: Byleth
text: I doubt it.

speaker: Catherine
text: Oof... You don't mince your words. Try being a bit more mindful of other people's feelings.

speaker: Catherine
text: Lady Rhea's not waiting for me, I know, no matter how much I might wish she were. She's waiting for you.

speaker: Shamir
text: Ten years ago, Dagda and Brigid attacked the Empire from the west. Their final target was the capital. But they were countered at a port town, long before they reached their destination. I guess our attempt has been more successful than theirs, all things considered.

speaker: Cyril
text: Whenever I think about how we'll be seeing Lady Rhea real soon, I get happy and really get cleaning! We'll get there for sure, right? We'll see her again?

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll meet her for sure.

speaker: Byleth
text: We don't know for sure.

speaker: Cyril
text: I just gotta believe Lady Rhea is waiting for us in the capital... We just have to find her.

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Momentum's really picking up for this final battle, huh? Even I'm starting to feel tense! ME! Enbarr's history goes back 1,400 years. That even predates the founding of the Empire. It's one of the sacred sites of the Seiros faith, so it's a pretty big deal. But hey, no need to worry about the monastery while you're fighting the final battle. I've got it covered! I'll defend it to my last!

speaker: Seteth
text: There it is. The greatest city in all of Fódlan... Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. Deep within are the palace grounds, where the emperor resides. If Rhea is being kept here, she must be within the palace... We shall tear through the city streets, capture the palace, and kill Edelgard at last.

speaker: Shamir
text: If the enemy spots us, they'll call back any troops deployed in other areas. We have no leeway here.

speaker: Cyril
text: Lady Rhea, please be safe.

speaker: Seteth
text: Now, we must organize our reserve troops and invade Enbarr!

speaker: Seteth
text: It appears that Hubert and the Death Knight are in command of the Empire's forces in the city. We've not the time to deal with them one by one. Split up and take both on at once!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: It's here! The Crest of Flames banner! There! On the other side of the canal!

speaker: Hubert
text: Uninvited guests, I see. Heh. Let's ensure they receive a warm welcome. Ready the artillery. Prepare to attack. Rocks, arrows, magic--rain death upon the enemy until they are silent as the grave. Reinforcements will fly in shortly. Defend the heavy weapons until they arrive.

speaker: Hubert
text: Our first wave of reinforcements is here. It will not be long until the next.

speaker: Seteth
text: Their reinforcements just keep on coming. We need to secure the artillery. That will make it easier to deal with them.

speaker: Hubert
text: We have reinforcements coming in from another direction. Deploy them as soon as they arrive.

speaker: Flayn
text: That church... It looks familiar. I believe that is where my parents first met.

speaker: Seteth
text: Ah--that church. I've such memories of that place. From a time before I was Seteth.

speaker: Manuela
text: Has it really been so long since I was in that opera house? Couldn't have imagined any of this back then.

speaker: Dorothea
text: The battle is nearing the opera house. I hope everyone in the company is safe.

speaker: Seteth
text: We have finally made it. I am sure that Edelgard is hiding in the palace, awaiting our arrival...

speaker: Flayn
text: Who is that? Is that not Dedue?!

speaker: Dedue
text: I heard knights had arrived. I came here to find you.

speaker: Byleth
text: How long have you been in Enbarr?

speaker: Dedue
text: I arrived not long after the battle at Gronder Field. I am here to kill Edelgard.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you doing in Enbarr

speaker: Dedue
text: I'm waiting for a chance to kill Edelgard. I have not yet been blessed with the opportunity.

speaker: Flayn
text: Will you now fight alongside us?

speaker: Dedue
text: We fight for different objectives. I swore to offer Edelgard's head to his Highness. But... Should I fail, I will have no choice but to entrust that mission to you. This is the information I have gathered during my time in hiding here. It includes details about the inside of the castle. There's more. The archbishop is being held in the palace. I do not know the exact location.

speaker: Seteth
text: Indeed! Just as we suspected!

speaker: Alois
text: It seems we chose wisely when we decided to fight against the Empire!

speaker: Dedue
text: I've done what I came here to do. Farewell.

speaker: Flayn
text: Wait a moment!

speaker: Flayn
text: He is gone. I believe we should make our way there as well!

speaker: Seteth
text: The messenger we sent to Claude has returned. It seems he will be initiating the plan immediately. We will advance when House Riegan's forces move out. We will take the Great Bridge of Myrddin with minimal casualties, and in doing so, initiate all-out war with the Empire. We must prepare for battle, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Someday, we'll take it back.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Thank you, Professor. I will not give in. Not until I have restored my noble pride!

speaker: Byleth
text: Taking it back would be difficult.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Yes, I know it would be difficult, but I will not give in!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sure they're not...

speaker: Linhardt
text: If I were in charge, it's what I would do.

speaker: Byleth
text: Probably.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I knew it. War makes people crazy, huh?

speaker: Caspar
text: The Airmid River separates the Empire and Alliance. It's the largest river in Fódlan. Sometimes it'll flood when there's lots of rain, but... At least the land gets some extra water!

speaker: Byleth
text: Sounds like you're learning.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't that a little pessimistic?

speaker: Byleth
text: No, it's not OK.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Makes sense. A commander running away would be terrible for morale.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wouldn't blame you.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Really? If something happens, will you keep me safe?

speaker: Petra
text: If we can suppress this Myrddin, we can invade into the Empire, Right? I was in the Empire. Now I will be an enemy... I am having strange feelings. It is with ease that an ally turns into an enemy...

speaker: Felix
text: We have the Empire and Alliance situations under control. The problem is Faerghus. The eastern lords have joined forces and are warring with the Dukedom. But I've heard nothing about that conflict as of late. It's strange. I haven't heard much from my father either. I can't help but find this silence unsettling...

speaker: Ashe
text: It's thanks to you that I'm here now. I owe you, Professor. You saved my life. I swear I'll do all I can to repay that debt.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I had an encounter with Lord Gwendal... How many years ago was it? Back before the academy, I met this girl who I fell madly in love with...and her dad tried to kill me. I suppose he just tried to scare me, but I was sure I was gonna die. Oh yeah, her dad? Lord Gwendal. Crazy, right? I never thought I'd seriously be trying to kill the guy in battle. I kind of don't know how to make sense of it.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Lady Rhea is in the Empire, isn't she? We should hurry up and find her. So many people in the monastery and nearby towns are worried... I want to ease their minds as soon as possible, Professor. Let's work together to find her!

speaker: Annette
text: Next we face the Great Bridge of Myrddin... We actually crossed it a long time ago. Do you remember? It was five whole years ago!

speaker: Byleth
text: During the Battle of the Eagle and Lion?

speaker: Annette
text: It seems like so long ago, doesn't it? It's odd how fast time flies...

speaker: Byleth
text: When we went to Remire Village?

speaker: Annette
text: What are you talking about, Professor? It was on the way to the Battle of the Eagle and Lion!

speaker: Annette
text: Everyone was still friends then. After the fighting, we all ate together without splitting into our separate houses. I often wish we could go back to those peaceful days...

speaker: Ingrid
text: So, that was Judith. Just as I'd heard of her, she was an upstanding person. The same Daphnel blood runs through my veins, and yet I feel as though I am nothing like her. I am but a phantom of what could be...

speaker: Byleth
text: You're actually quite alike.

speaker: Ingrid
text: You think so? Wow, thank you!

speaker: Byleth
text: True, you do differ.

speaker: Ingrid
text: If only I could be even half of who she is.

speaker: Raphael
text: Thanks to all that food from Judith, I'm full for once! I've got so much energy! Let me at that Great Bridge of Myrddin! I'll bust it down myself! Oh, but then how do we cross?

speaker: Ignatz
text: The Great Bridge of Myrddin isn't just a bridge, It has the features of a fortress. I believe it was built for military purposes by the first leader of the Adrestian Empire. In other words, it's even older than the monastery. So if we occupy the Great Bridge, we'll have to search it from top to bottom.

speaker: Lysithea
text: I'm sure you know this already, but House Ordelia is aligned with the Empire. They face the Empire from across the river, similar to the Gloucesters. Even so, I refuse to yield to the Empire a second time. The Empire did unthinkable things to my family. And to me. The only option here is winning. Professor, you must promise we will overcome the Empire.

speaker: Marianne
text: Legend says that pillars of light fell and ravaged Ailell. I was reminded of that when I saw it... Up, Professor? Do you think those legends are true?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's likely.

speaker: Marianne
text: I think so too. I don't know if the goddess really destroyed the valley out of anger, but...

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes, and it'll likely happen again.

speaker: Marianne
text: Oh! I suppose you may be right. There's no way to be sure it won't...

speaker: Marianne
text: There are still so many things we don't understand in this world.

speaker: Hilda
text: It looks like people are slowly starting to come back to the town. I guess they feel safe now that you and the Knights of Seiros have returned. Peddlers have become more common too, so there'll be food and supplies available. After being run-down for all those years, it's really becoming livable again!

speaker: Leonie
text: Things would have gotten a lot more interesting if Judith had joined us. I only spoke to her briefly, but I really liked her. I hope someday I can be as strong, kind, and levelheaded as her.

speaker: Seteth
text: If Rhea really is in the Empire, then we must defeat the Imperial army by any means necessary. The people at large are just as concerned for Rhea's safety as we are. The sooner we can settle all our unease, the better.

speaker: Flayn
text: Judith is a wonderful person. So strong and confident, as well. Looking upon her, I was sharply reminded of my mother.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did she look similar?

speaker: Flayn
text: Not in the slightest. Rather, it is her way of being--her demeanor. Brilliantly bright and positive, like a warm ray of light.

speaker: Byleth
text: Did she act similar?

speaker: Flayn
text: Very much so! Both brilliantly bright and positive, like a warm ray of light.

speaker: Flayn
text: I...lost my mother, long ago. I miss her desperately.

speaker: Hanneman
text: The battle at Ailell was a tactical marvel. You grow stronger with each passing day. Where does you talent end and your Crest's power begin? Are they one and the same, I wonder? Most intriguing. Yet it is quite difficult to draw useful conclusions, given the situation. It is quite unfortunate I did not achieve my research goals before the war broke out. So much unknown. Now, I fear I will not have those answers even by conflict's end. So very frustrating.

speaker: Manuela
text: Oh, hello there, Professor. Did you need something from me? It doesn't look like you're wounded or anything. You just looking for...someone to talk to?

speaker: Byleth
text: Yes.

speaker: Manuela
text: I thought so. Well, I'm here for you! Making you feel better is my top priority.

speaker: Byleth
text: No.

speaker: Manuela
text: Come on now, you don't have to be shy. Helping you feel better is important to me.

speaker: Manuela
text: Whether it's physical pain or worries of the heart, you can come to me for anything, Professor.

speaker: Alois
text: So, Lady Rhea was in the Empire all this time. Glad as I am that Judith told us, I wish we had known this five years ago. We spent all that time spread out over Fódlan, searching for the archbishop and you. It was a mistake to abandon the monastery, to leave it in ruins. Now we're paying for that mistake.

speaker: Catherine
text: I'd heard of the Hero of Daphnel, but that was the first time I've met her in person. She's the head of a prestigious noble family? Just like Claude. The Alliance nobility is so...odd.

speaker: Byleth
text: You don't think she acts like a noble?

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it different in the Kingdom and Empire?

speaker: Catherine
text: Kind of, but I don't mean that in a bad way. You won't find such big-hearted nobles elsewhere. Plus, Judith can drink with the best of'em! A woman after my own heart.

speaker: Shamir
text: Five years ago, when the Imperial army attacked Garreg Mach, they moved with incredible speed. But in the middle of all that chaos, she still had operatives watching. The Hero of Daphnel's spy network is impressive. She shouldn't be taken lightly.

speaker: Cyril
text: Is it true Lady Rhea was dragged off by the Imperial army? I heard that was true. Why'd they take Lady Rhea? Professor...they didn't take her to kill her, did they?

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Cyril
text: That's good. We just gotta beat the Imperial army and get her back, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: They probably haven't killed her.

speaker: Cyril
text: Yeah, good point. If they did, we'd have heard about it by now.

speaker: Cyril
text: You gotta help her, Professor. I'm begging ya.

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Oh! I heard what happened at Ailell. I can't believe Imperial spies have been lurking in Garreg Mach! Under my watch! But I'll make sure no more of 'em get in, trust me!

speaker: Seteth
text: This is the Great Bridge of Myrddin, one of the bridges that cuts across the Airmid River between the Empire and the Alliance. Its defenses have been fortified since I last was here. It seems the enemy is sufficiently prepared.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's end this quickly.

speaker: Manuela
text: That's the idea, Professor. Let's make this quick and painless. So much that it's over before they even know it's started.

speaker: Byleth
text: Steady now.

speaker: Hanneman
text: If they are fully equipped, we must prepare ourselves for anything. We must be ready to change our approach in an instant.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, that is most sound. I do not distrust Claude, but there is no guarantee that the other Alliance lords will not move against us. Onward, with caution.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: After we cross the Great Bridge, the greatest plains in Fódlan will be before us. You do remember, do you not? I speak of Gronder Field, where we fought the Battle of the Eagle and Lion.

speaker: Caspar
text: The ones defending the Great Bridge... It isn't my father or brother, is it? I really want to finish this battle without seeing them. Especially my father...

speaker: Linhardt
text: Yes, I hear your father can fell a bear without even a weapon in hand. When we run into him, I'll be sure to let you take the lead. Family matters, and all.

speaker: Caspar
text: That's not funny, you jerk!

speaker: Petra
text: Should we be burning the signal of uprising?

speaker: Dorothea
text: There's no need for that, Petra. Smoke or no smoke, they'll get the idea. Losing the bridge should be a pretty big clue.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh no! I can't believe we're actually going to invade! If Edelgard...gets angry... Oh, I get nervous just picturing it! Stop that, imagination! Oh, and if she destroys the monastery with her army, we're all gonna die!

speaker: Seteth
text: The hour of questioning has long since passed. I assure you, whatever happens, this will not end as it did five years ago. Back then, the Empire was able to focus its entire army on Garreg Mach. Now their front lines are stretched thin along their borders with both the Kingdom and the Alliance. Their allies have grown in number, but so have their enemies. They should not have too many soldiers they can readily send our way. Now then, let us set forth! This shall be the first step in ending the chaos that has engulfed this realm!

speaker: Ladislava
text: That symbol... It's an enemy raid! Stay calm and face them head-on. Send a messenger to Acheron immediately! If we're quick, we might be able to pull off a pincer attack!

speaker: Seteth
text: That is Ladislava. She has, of late, made quite a name for herself as a general. Be on your guard.

speaker: Seteth
text: We will control this fortress if we can eliminate all the enemies within it.

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Enemies approaching! Get the soldiers standing by to join the fight! We may need to hurry up preparations of the ballista too. Protect the fortress!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: You think we'll let you take this bridge form us

speaker: Seteth
text: It appears enemy soldiers are stationed in the fortress. More will come. Stay on your guard!

speaker: Lorenz
text: I, Lorenz Hellman Gloucester, have arrived to join the battle in my father's stead!

speaker: Alliance General
text: We'll ally ourselves with the Imperial soldiers too!

speaker: Ladislava
text: Thanks for making your way here. Annihilate the enemy with the rest of them!

speaker: Ladislava
text: Acheron! Now's the time to show your loyalty to the Empire! Attack the enemy from behind!

speaker: Acheron
text: I've got to make her name known to Her Majesty through distinguished service.

speaker: Seteth
text: That is Acheron, a minor Alliance noble. If he has allied with the Empire, then we must destroy him.

speaker: Seteth
text: Goddess, please forgive the sins of the enemy leaders and the brave soldiers who followed their orders.

speaker: Seteth
text: Somehow we managed to capture the Great Bridge of Myrddin. To see the Imperial Army hold its ground until every last soldier fell... That is true dedication. It is clear that Edelgard is not some cruel emperor who holds her people in a vice-like grip. There is something more driving our foes. From here on out, our journey will not be an easy one...

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Excuse me, sir! Gilbert is here!

speaker: Seteth
text: Gilbert?! What was he doing all this time? We had better go and meet with him.

speaker: Gilbert
text: So you've captured the Great Bridge of Myrddin. I'm impressed you were able to break through their defenses.

speaker: Seteth
text: Save your praise, Gilbert. Let's get to the heart of the matter. Why are you here? Why now?

speaker: Gilbert
text: I am once again in the service of Dimitri. He was in hiding in Fraldarius territory, where he was biding his time for a counteroffensive.

speaker: Seteth
text: Dimitri is alive?!

speaker: Gilbert
text: Yes. He was to be executed in Fhirdiad, but Dedue stepped forward to rescue him. I am here today by command of Dimitri himself. We realize that our enemies are the same...and that it may be advantageous to join forces.

speaker: Seteth
text: I see. I shall hear you out.

speaker: Gilbert
text: We are preparing to advance against the Empire. Will you join us as we march toward the Imperial capital? If that is too much to ask, then at least allow us to freely cross the Great Bridge of Myrddin.

speaker: Byleth
text: We will join you.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hold a moment. We have just finished a fierce battle, and our forces are few.

speaker: Byleth
text: You may cross freely.

speaker: Seteth
text: Agreed. We have just finished a fierce battle, and our forces are few.

speaker: Seteth
text: To march straight for the main body of the Imperial army and challenge them? It is too soon. I am happy yo allow you safe passage over the bridge, but to lend our aid asks too much of us. Is that not so? If you would be willing to wait a few months, we might be able to offer something more.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I am afraid His Highness is not able to stop his advance...

speaker: Seteth
text: If that is the case, I am afraid we cannot join you. Please, send our regards to Dimitri.

speaker: Gilbert
text: I understand. It's unfortunate that we were not able to secure the help of the Knights of Seiros. Still, I'm grateful that we can cross the Great Bridge of Myrddin safely. Thank you for that. This will be a fight to the death. It is highly likely that we will meet our end. I wish you both the best of luck in the battles ahead.

speaker: Seteth
text: And may the goddess protect you as well.

speaker: Seteth
text: The Empire has been defeated, and we have rescued Rhea. But still, the flames of war burn on. We journey to Shambhala, where those who slither in the dark reside.

speaker: Flayn
text: We know nothing of the place or what we can expect to find there.

speaker: Seteth
text: What Flayn says is true. If we are to prevail, we must be prepared for any eventuality before we advance.

speaker: Rhea
text: I will accompany you.

speaker: Seteth
text: What?! No! That would be far too dangerous! Your long confinement weakened you greatly, did it not?

speaker: Rhea
text: Those people have opposed us since ancient times. I wish to learn the truth about them for myself.

speaker: Seteth
text: I...I understand. I will not stop you, but please take care not to overexert yourself.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: What?! But she's been hiding away so long! She shouldn't just up and go somewhere scary. Trust me, it's a bad idea!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Bernadetta, "hiding away" seems a poor description for someone who was imprisoned.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: We must be careful not to put undue stress on Lady Rhea.

speaker: Caspar
text: If the going gets tough, we'll have to carry her on our backs and make a run for it!

speaker: Dorothea
text: You think you can carry her? Um, maybe someone else should do that part...

speaker: Petra
text: No matter what enemies are appearing, we will be protecting her. We will be winning!

speaker: Flayn
text: If we work together, I am certain all will be well...

speaker: Seteth
text: The ones we are soon to face have eluded us for a long time. There is much to fear... We must all proceed with utmost caution, lest we fall prey to one of their traps.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: The history of the Empire spans 1185 years. And just like that, it ends. But the Hresvelg legacy could live on... When Edelgard assumed power, there were no other rightful heirs. She said that whoever takes the throne next should do so by the virtue of merit, not blood. And she truly meant what she said. At any rate... I feel that a huge hole has opened up in my heart. Who knows if it can ever be filled?

speaker: Linhardt
text: As history proves, everything comes to an end eventually. I knew that all along, but it still came as a surprise. Those who slither in the dark... It's all so fascinating and strange. They must certainly have a long history of their own. And when they fall, that will come quickly too. Don't you think? Heh, that almost sounded like a prophecy there. Am I spooking you yet?

speaker: Caspar
text: He's dead... My father's dead... I'm OK though. Really. I was ready for it. He was a general in the Imperial army, after all. Minister of Military Affairs... He gave his own life so the Empire's soldiers wouldn't have to lose theirs. That's a fight that only he could take on. He was such a tough guy. I fought side by side with you this whole time. But did I ever get any stronger? Will I ever be as strong as my father?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: With Edelgard gone, maybe Fódlan will finally find some peace. That's all well and good, but, um... She was also the one to put my father under house arrest, so now he's been released, and he's taken charge of House Varley. I can't handle it! I can't deal with him! Please, you have to do something!

speaker: Byleth
text: How about we exile him?

speaker: Byleth
text: We can put him back under arrest.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Thank you so much!

speaker: Dorothea
text: So, the moment we defeat Edie, the nobles cozy up to the Alliance and the Church... That lot really does think only of themselves, and no one else. But then there's Count Bergliez. He used to be Minister of Military Affairs... He sacrificed his own life so that all the soldiers and officers who fought could be given quarter... When I heard that... I don't know... that simple act of humanity... I couldn't help it. I burst into tears. You know Count Bergliez is Caspar's father, right? I can't even imagine how Caspar must feel about it.

speaker: Petra
text: The Empire has broken in... in smithereens. Now it is possible for me to go back to Brigid. But... I cannot choose that choice. The time is still too soon for that. We must be stopping the evil for everyone in Fódlan. We will be fighting until the end of it!

speaker: Felix
text: I thought that after the Empire fell, the boar might finally be avenged... But something dark is certainly lurking in the shadows - an organization behind the Empire. We'll have to take care of them if the boar... if Dimitri is to rest in peace.

speaker: Ashe
text: I've only ever done what I thought was just. I've got no regrets, but sometimes I do wonder if I've done the right thing. Was all this really for the best? Sorry - thinking about the end of the war makes me reconsider all kinds of things. But it's not over yet, is it? I need to steel myself for the next battle.

speaker: Sylvain
text: This war might be over but not war in general. Human beings thrive on conflict. We can't get enough of it. I don't know when, but you know someday another war will begin.

speaker: Byleth
text: Even so...

speaker: Sylvain
text: Heh heh... That's the way it is, right?

speaker: Byleth
text: You're probably right on that.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Yeah, but the fight is still worth it.

speaker: Sylvain
text: War may always come back but so will peace. And peace is what we fight for.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Lady Rhea still seems weak... but at least she's safe now. I'm praying that she'll be well as soon as possible. Goddess... I beg you... Protect Lady Rhea!

speaker: Annette
text: Finally, that awful war is over. Everyone lost something, and everyone had to make sacrifices... But maybe we can put a stop to all of this pain and loss now. Let's hurry to Shambhala, Professor! We have to defeat them if we ever want to see a world without war.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Is it really prudent to bring Lady Rhea on our upcoming expedition? It would be best not to have her doing anything strenuous, considering how long she was confined...

speaker: Byleth
text: It's her decision, ultimately.

speaker: Byleth
text: I feel similarly.

speaker: Ingrid
text: There are still many in Fódlan who are seeking Lady Rhea's salvation. For their sake, we cannot put her in harm's way.

speaker: Lorenz
text: A mysterious power threatening the very future of Fódlan? Certainly we cannot give it leeway. Right now, the Empire, the Kingdom, and even the Alliance no longer exist. There is only Fódlan - and Fódlan must fight together as one!

speaker: Byleth
text: Aren't you frightened?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Fear will serve no purpose here. The only path to survival now is victory.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you think we can defeat it?

speaker: Lorenz
text: There is simply no option but victory! The alternative is unthinkable.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Perhaps I will have the opportunity to strike the decisive blow on the enemy commander. That would secure my place in history for certain!

speaker: Raphael
text: Wake up, eat, train, eat, train, eat, sleep. We gotta prepare for the assault, but that hasn't changed my routine!

speaker: Byleth
text: You're doing plenty.

speaker: Byleth
text: Isn't there more you can do?

speaker: Raphael
text: All the training... and eating... I do is for the sake of Fódlan! Gotta stay strong... and fed... to keep it safe!

speaker: Ignatz
text: Our next opponent is an ally of Solon. Do you remember what Solon called us?

speaker: Byleth
text: Traitors?

speaker: Ignatz
text: No. He called us beasts.

speaker: Byleth
text: Beasts?

speaker: Ignatz
text: That's right. He called us beasts.

speaker: Byleth
text: Insects?

speaker: Ignatz
text: No. He called us beasts.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Meanwhile, he refers to himself as the Savior. Who exactly is he saving?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Those who slither in the dark... It seems we'll finally discover their true form. I get the sense that they're in league with the mages who experimented on me as a child. I wouldn't be surprised if Edelgard was subjected to them too. There's no telling what their true motives are. But whatever their motives, what they have done is unforgivable. They must be exterminated.

speaker: Marianne
text: I thought the war would end with Edelgard's defeat... But that wasn't the case. This may be premature, but I'm feeling a little relieved. I'll have to consider what I'll do with myself and where I'll go when this war is finally over... I don't have an answer yet... Let's make sure the next battle puts an end to this war. That way we can all move forward!

speaker: Hilda
text: Shambhala it was called, right? Scary that it's so close to the House Goneril territories. Who'd have thought all those creeps were living under my nose? I was hoping my big brother would help us in the next battle. But he says that I can represent House Goneril without his help. That I have it in me. I'm glad he recognizes that I have some ability. Still, I wish he wasn't leaving it all to me.

speaker: Leonie
text: These are Monica's people, aren't they? The ones who killed Captain Jeralt. Then this is my real opportunity for revenge. There's no way I can back down from this one.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're not scared?

speaker: Leonie
text: No, I'm OK. Actually, I'm eager to get out there and fight. This is what I've been training for.

speaker: Byleth
text: I wonder if we can win.

speaker: Leonie
text: If we lose, it's the end for Fódlan. So we have to win, even if it kills us.

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea is sleeping right now. If it is not absolutely urgent, please do not disturb her rest. The long confinement took its toll on her health. Truthfully, she is in no shape to be exerting herself at all - to say nothing of a military expedition. To make matters worse, we are now facing a very old enemy. One that has conspired against us since time out of mind. Please proceed with caution. I have a bad feeling.

speaker: Flayn
text: I am so glad that Rhea is unharmed. My brother continues to worry about her, however. Of course, I am worried myself. I cannot imagine being in that situation while in such a state... I hope she will rest now and leave it up to you and my brother to see things through.

speaker: Hanneman
text: A mysterious organization, slithering in the dark of Fódlan... Like something out of a midnight tale. It appears these fiends have infiltrated the deepest corners of the Empire. After the fall of Enbarr, they've remained well concealed... That said, I would keep an eye on Edelgard's uncle, Lord Arundel. Something about him sits ill with me.

speaker: Manuela
text: Professor! I just got word from the opera company. I don't know if everyone survived, but it looks like they should be able to mount a revival. They even asked if I'd consider making a return to the stage someday... I suspect I may refuse though. We're at the dawn of something new. No reason to look backwards, eh?

speaker: Alois
text: You've done it. You did it. You crushed the Empire, and rescued Lady Rhea. I'm sure the captain is proud of you right now. As am I, of course! I'm as proud as if I'd done it myself!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's not celebrate just yet.

speaker: Byleth
text: We still have opponents left to fight.

speaker: Alois
text: Sorry I didn't mean to overdo it. We still have to deal with Monica's group... Those who killed the captain. We'll knock 'em down so hard that they can't get back up!

speaker: Catherine
text: We rescued Lady Rhea! I can hardly express my joy. But now we know about a new foe, who intends to bring her harm. In time, we'll realize the peaceful world that Lady Rhea has always hoped for. I'll have to keep that in mind when I'm fighting.

speaker: Shamir
text: We saved Rhea and the Empire has crumbled. The Kingdom may as well be finished too. The reasons for me to remain in Fódlan are fading.

speaker: Byleth
text: Please, stay with us a little longer.

speaker: Shamir
text: Of course. I've come this far. May as well see it through to the end.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is it time to bid farewell?

speaker: Shamir
text: That's a little hasty. I've come this far. May as well see it through the end.

speaker: Cyril
text: Lady Rhea's back! Lady Rhea's back! I'm so happy! But... things aren't gonna be like they used to be any time soon, are they? There's still folks out there that want us all dead, and Lady Rhea still hasn't regained her strength yet. Speaking of which, Professor, please don't ask too much of her right now, OK?

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! I can hardly believe you managed to handle the capital city like that. Everyone did sterling work! I really thought we'd know peace after that battle. But we're not quite there yet, huh?

speaker: Flayn
text: To think there is such a vast space hidden beneath the ground. How very creepy.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Hmm, the atmosphere here is very different from the Holy Mausoleum or the Holy Tomb. Look at the shapes and the light...

speaker: Caspar
text: It's too strange... It's all really old, but you get the feeling that it's also...new? I don't understand it.

speaker: Petra
text: This decorating is not of Fódlan... What is the meaning here?

speaker: Dorothea
text: I hate the look of things in here. Is this some kind of city? I would never, ever live here.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Living underground...all safe and isolated... It sounds really... Um! Really awful!

speaker: Ferdinand
text: An underground city hiding those who slither in the dark. I would not mind finishing up here and returning to the surface with haste.

speaker: Seteth
text: Let us search for a way to descend further still. We should survey our surroundings carefully.

speaker: Byleth
text: Something on your mind?

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you not feeling well?

speaker: Rhea
text: No. It is simply… We must defeat those who slither in the dark, no matter what happens. But if my conjecture is correct, the one who they will wish to kill the most…

speaker: Rhea
text: Is you, dear child.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why me?

speaker: Rhea
text: They are aware that you can use the Sword of the Creator. Your body houses the same power they once bestowed upon Nemesis. That is why I must protect you, no matter what. Even if I must die to do so...

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't understand.

speaker: Rhea
text: Somewhere in your heart, I believe you do understand. You must at least have your suspicions. There is something I have not yet told you, dear child... I swear to illuminate you once this awful battle has concluded. And at the same time... I will offer my apologies to you. I must, because...when you learn the truth, you will also learn what you are, and how you were born into this world. It will be a hard truth to hear. When the time comes, I hope you are prepared for it...

speaker: Thales
text: For thousands of years, we have existed underground, living on only that we might someday see our vengeance realized. Here and now, that vengeance is finally within our grasp. There is but one thing left to do. Destroy them! Damn those who stand with that arrogant goddess to oblivion, away from the world of the living!

speaker: Thales
text: Now is the time. Remove the binding spell of Titanus. Let their metal bodies be drenched in blood!

speaker: Seteth
text: What is that?!

speaker: Rhea
text: Demonic Beasts… No, I think not. They appear to have no will of their own. Someone must be controlling them.

speaker: Thales
text: Initiate all that remain! We must advance our preparations!

speaker: Thales
text: Viskam has been activated? Increase output gradually, depending on the amount of magical energy charged. I don't care if we destroy Shambhala, as long as our goals are fulfilled!

speaker: Seteth
text: They're trying to take something out of here. We should capture them before they escape.

speaker: Seteth
text: More of these giant weapons?! They must be controlled by someone nearby. That facility over there seems suspicious.

speaker: Rhea
text: Those awful weapons have been stopped. They were being controlled from that facility!

speaker: Seteth
text: Finally, they've stopped! That should make things easier.

speaker: Thales
text: You!

speaker: Rhea
text: That is the leader of those who slither in the dark. We must go after him with all our might!

speaker: Edelgard
text: *sighs* Why am I even here? I know they won't come, but here I am anyway. How has it already been five years? Time stops for no one, I suppose.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Huh? It's-- It's you! What are you doing here?

speaker: Byleth
text: I came here for you.

speaker: Edelgard
text: For me?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure myself.

speaker: Byleth
text: A whim.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Highly doubtful. So you were alive. What have you been doing all this time?

speaker: Byleth
text: I was sleeping.

speaker: Byleth
text: I was dead.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Joking at a time like this. Well if you don't wish to tell me, I won't persuade you. All that matters is this: Will you return to the Empire with me?

speaker: Edelgard
text: Before you answer, know that friends from our Black Eagle days have chosen to join me in the fight ahead.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Hesitation. It betrays your true answer.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't.

speaker: Edelgard
text: As expected. I knew your answer before I had even asked the question.

speaker: Edelgard
text: That means... we're enemies now, you and I. My teacher, the time for discussion has come to an end.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Even though our swords may cross as they do now--

speaker: Edelgard
text: --there's no denying that our chosen paths never will.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Goodbye, my teacher. When next we meet, one of us will breath their last.

speaker: Seteth
text: Who is it?! Is that-- It's you!

speaker: Byleth
text: It's been a long time.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, it has been! But this is no time for casual chatter!

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Seteth
text: I was going to ask you the very same thing.

speaker: Seteth
text: After you disappeared five years ago, do you have any idea how dire the church's situation became? Where were you, and what were you doing all of those years?

speaker: Byleth
text: I was sleeping.

speaker: Seteth
text: You slept for five years... In that case, I suppose there is nothing more to say. You should know that Rhea also disappeared after the battle at Garreg Mach five years ago. Since then, the knights have been fully devoted to searching for her. They have yet to find a trace.

speaker: Byleth
text: Was she captured by the Imperial army?

speaker: Byleth
text: Was she murdered by the Imperial army?

speaker: Seteth
text: It is possible. However, the Empire has not made any such statement as of yet. Even if that were the truth, there is no way for us to confirm. We have searched all over, but we have reached an impasse. Unless we do something, our efforts to find Rhea and rebuild the Church will be stalled indefinitely. Our opportunity to strike back is close at hand. Sadly, we are short on military strength. However, now we have you. Do you recall what Rhea told you five years ago? She asked for you to take her place should anything ever happen to her. She entrusted you with leading the people of Fódlan.

speaker: Byleth
text: I remember.

speaker: Seteth
text: Then I beg of you, please, heed her words.

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't do that.

speaker: Seteth
text: I will not accept that. Please... you must lend me your strength.

speaker: Seteth
text: It is up to you to lead us and to defeat the Empire-- no, to defeat Edelgard.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why me?

speaker: Seteth
text: There is a very good reason...but it is not yet time to divulge it. Just know that without you, we have no hope.

speaker: Byleth
text: You should lead them.

speaker: Seteth
text: It is not for me to do. You are the only one who can rise to this task. Someday, you will know why that is. Until then, I ask that you trust me.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't want to fight Edelgard.

speaker: Seteth
text: What are you saying? She is tormenting all of Fódlan! And you are the only one who can save us! How can you not see that?!

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Sir! Bandits have entered the area! They stole some hidden weapons and ran off! They're heading for the town, so that might be where they're hiding out...

speaker: Seteth
text: Vile thieves! Even with the knights gone, I cannot believe they would dare trespass here! This is unforgivable! Come, Professor. Let us give chase!

speaker: Seteth
text: Looters deserve no forgiveness! After them!

speaker: Pallardó
text: What the… Intruders! Protect the goods!

speaker: Seteth
text: Stop the thieves! Retrieve our stolen goods!

speaker: Dorothea
text: We had no place to go so we came back to Garreg Mach. But then -- Huh? Professor?

speaker: Caspar
text: Looks like there's a fight! I'm ready to join the battle!

speaker: Petra
text: It is confirmed that Professor is alive. I will be...cooperating.

speaker: Seteth
text: What are you doing here?! Never mind, we'll have to talk later! Help us with these thieves!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: People? A battle?! Oh, there wasn't supposed to be anyone here! Wait, is that... Professor?!

speaker: Linhardt
text: Professor... You're alive after all. Well then, I am quite pleased with my choice to come here.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Professor?! Never mind... We have to focus on winning this fight!

speaker: Seteth
