text: Lend us a hand! Let's beat them back!

speaker: Seteth
text: If we split our troops in two, we can attack from the north and the south to trap their leader.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Do you remember our promise from five years ago, Professor? Today's the day.

speaker: Caspar
text: I'm so glad I get to see you again, Professor!

speaker: Petra
text: I went back to Brigid once...but I had to be returning to Fódlan.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Ah, Professor. You have not changed a bit. I am so glad to fight alongside you again.

speaker: Linhardt
text: So what have you been doing these past five years? Sleeping?! Why, I must say I'm a bit envious.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Took all my will to come out here today. But seeing you again, Professor? That's worth a little torture!

speaker: Pallardó
text: No! I'm not the one you want! Gah! I guess I've got no choice.

speaker: Pallardó
text: It isn't looking good for us. Should we retreat?

speaker: Seteth
text: He has some treasure from the monastery too! Do not let him escape!

speaker: Seteth
text: It seems we were able to expel the bandits who were hiding in Garreg Mach. How fortuitous that you students should gather at the monastery like this...

speaker: Dorothea
text: We made a promise with the professor. That was five years ago to the very day.

speaker: Petra
text: We all gave our promise to be meeting here when the millennium festival arrived.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Though the one who came up with that plan is not here... Edelgard. Still, how incredible that those present gathered despite the terrible state of things...

speaker: Caspar
text: Pfft, the most incredible part of it is that you didn't oversleep and miss the reunion!

speaker: Seteth
text: So, that is the reason... Professor. The monastery is safe because of your devoted students. I am now fully convinced you are the only one who can save Fódlan.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's taking it a bit far.

speaker: Seteth
text: No, not so.

speaker: Byleth
text: You can count on me.

speaker: Seteth
text: Ah, so you have finally accepted your destiny.

speaker: Seteth
text: On the very day I return to Garreg Mach, you awaken and return as well. This is no mere coincidence but, rather, the work of the goddess.

speaker: Byleth
text: What's your reason for being here?

speaker: Seteth
text: Actually... Well, it would be easier to just show you. Come with me to the Holy Mausoleum. I realize that since you have been slumbering for so long, you have no idea what has transpired in the various territories. Allow me to explain... After the Battle of Garreg Mach, there was a change of regime in the Kingdom. House Blaiddyd suffered a series of brutal massacres, which claimed the lives of Dimitri and Regent Rufus. The Kingdom capital fell and was absorbed into the Empire as the Faerghus Dukedom, which is now under Cornelia's control. Some still resist the Empire. As of now, Rodrigue of House Fraldarius is at the center of such efforts. In the Alliance, Claude leads the faction that opposes the Empire, and Lorenz leads those who have sided with them. The front lines are ever in motion, but the war effort has stagnated overall. In short, both the Kingdom and the Alliance have been swallowed up by the Empire and are on the verge of collapse. We must gather our generals and soldiers under your command and reverse this dire situation.

speaker: Seteth
text: Flayn, look! The professor has returned to us!

speaker: Flayn
text: Hm? What do you mean... Oh! Goodness! It really IS you, Professor! I cannot believe you are still of this world! We were so worried we would never see you again.

speaker: Byleth
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Flayn
text: I forgot something important at the Holy Mausoleum... I told my brother I had to go back for it no matter what, and so here I am...

speaker: Seteth
text: After we finished here, we were going to continue our search for Rhea. But now that you are here, things have changed. We must not waste this opportunity. We shall send word to the knights scattered all across the land. The time has come for the Knights of Seiros to return to action. We are counting on you, Professor!

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Emergency! In Gronder Field... There's a... It's...

speaker: Seteth
text: We are in the middle of a military conference. Please calm yourself and tell us what is the matter.

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Yes, sir! It seems that the Kingdom and Alliance armies clashed with Imperial forces on Gronder Field! Amid the chaos of three armies battling each other out there, the Imperial army was routed! Edelgard sustained heavy wounds and retreated to Enbarr!

speaker: Seteth
text: Well then! I suppose...

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Sir! The Kingdom army was also decimated and... His Highness, Dimitri, has been counted among the dead.

speaker: Seteth
text: What?!

speaker: Church Soldier
text: The Alliance sustained heavy casualties as well. And the whereabouts of their leader, Claude, is currently unknown.

speaker: Seteth
text: Unknown? I...

speaker: Byleth
text: Edelgard is injured...

speaker: Byleth
text: Dimitri is dead...

speaker: Byleth
text: Claude is missing...

speaker: Seteth
text: It must have been a brutal fight. To have lost His Highness... How tragic. Our only solace is that Edelgard sustained severe injuries. This is all quite unexpected, but we must find a way to use this situation to our advantage. The Empire's main force has suffered a mighty blow. Edelgard will most certainly avoid the front lines. Now is the time for us to infiltrate the Empire and aim for the capital.

speaker: Flayn
text: But...what will happen to the lords of the old Kingdom and Alliance territories?

speaker: Seteth
text: They have lost many leaders and soldiers. I am sure they must be hard at work rebuilding. We will foster cooperation by aiding them through the local churches. The remaining lords of the Kingdom and Alliance must join together to form one union. And you should be the one to lead them... What do you say?

speaker: Byleth
text: In time...

speaker: Byleth
text: I can't decide that just yet.

speaker: Seteth
text: Indeed. It is a question for another day. We must focus on our battle with the Empire. For now, what is our next course of action?

speaker: Byleth
text: We should set out.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's decide where to invade first.

speaker: Seteth
text: We must choose a place within the Empire that will give us solid defenses for our front line... That will become the foothold for our invasion of the capital. There is one massive fortress that boasts the greatest defenses in the Empire...Fort Merceus. But we will stand no chance if we attack by traditional means. We must gather everyone and devise a plan of attack.

speaker: Dimitri
text: ... It has been a lifetime... Hasn't it, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: I thought you were dead.

speaker: Dimitri
text: Yes... I thought so too. I wanted to slice her throat...but I did not get the chance. I let people die, and yet... I still stand. Rodrigue, Gustave, Dedue...

speaker: Byleth
text: There must be a reason you survived.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You sound just like Rodrigue. A reason...

speaker: Byleth
text: You can still atone for your sins.

speaker: Dimitri
text: You sound just like Rodrigue. A way to absolve my sins...

speaker: Dimitri
text: Everyone gives such complicated advice, and I can never quite grasp it all. That is why... Professor. I came here to explain my decision.

speaker: Byleth
text: What decision?

speaker: Dimitri
text: I have no resources to take back the Kingdom capital, much less to defeat the Empire. And that is why...

speaker: Seteth
text: Professor! You will catch a cold sleeping in a place like this. Is something the matter?

speaker: Byleth
text: Where did he go?

speaker: Seteth
text: Hm? I am the only one here. Were you dreaming?

speaker: Seteth
text: I can't say for certain that you were dreaming, but if someone did come here to see you... That person only wanted you to see their face. Perhaps they wanted you to guide them...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Dimitri, the late prince of Faerghus. He despised the Empire with all his heart. He should not have tried leading an army while his emotions were holding him captive.

speaker: Byleth
text: Leaders are people too.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't leaders have feelings, like everyone else?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: True enough, but I suspect the reason he died is that he could not keep his emotions in check. I see. You are saying you met with Dimitri? But you could not tell if it was reality or a dream. Hm. I wonder what it could mean.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I'm rather curious to see what stratagem we'll devise to capture the fortress. You know Fort Merceus's nickname, I assume. The Stubborn Old General? But there must be one or two gaps in its defenses...

speaker: Caspar
text: Fort Merceus is next, huh? Ah, the memories. It's a huge stronghold in my father's domain. The town's completely surrounded by high walls. I used to run around there when I was a kid... Way back when a fortress was a playground for me. Yeah, those were the days.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: It's always so peaceful coming back here. But it's hard to relax knowing we have to go out on another expedition again so soon. And assaulting that huge keep? That sounds hard. Oh, really, hard! Don't you think it'll be hard?!

speaker: Byleth
text: It's going to be tough.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I knew you'd think so! I knew you-- Ow! Oh, ow. Can't believe I tried to hug you through the door...

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll be fine.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Of course you'd say that! Why'd I even ask?!

speaker: Dorothea
text: I heard that a staggering number of people lost their loves in the battle at Gronder. And here we are, preparing for the next battle, as if nothing happened the day before. It's almost easier to think about war as theater, with the stage an entire continent.

speaker: Byleth
text: Though actors die, the show goes on?

speaker: Dorothea
text: Something like that. If an accident happens on stage, the next day's performance must be unaffected.

speaker: Byleth
text: It really doesn't seem like theater.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Even if an accident happens on stage, the next day you have to sing as though nothing happened.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Everyone just pretends like everything is fine... focusing on their role in the play.

speaker: Petra
text: I have excitement in my heart for secret tactics! I enjoy attacks that are surprising.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why's that?

speaker: Petra
text: Surprise attacks are safe with friends. Fewer injuries.

speaker: Byleth
text: Because it's like hunting?

speaker: Petra
text: Yes. Hunting is doing surprise attacks on prey. Surprise attacks are safe with friends. Fewer injuries.

speaker: Felix
text: It hasn't sunk in yet. They slaughtered the boar... I can hardly believe it. I thought he was alive all this time. He must have really hated Edelgard to lead such an ill-advised assault. Hmph. No point in feeling sorry for the poor scoundrel now.

speaker: Ashe
text: I've heard Dedue's passed on. Just like His Highness.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can't know that for certain.

speaker: Ashe
text: That's true. I did hear that his body was never found.

speaker: Byleth
text: Don't believe everything you hear.

speaker: Ashe
text: You're right. I don't think anyone's found his body, so I guess he might still be out there.

speaker: Byleth
text: Dedue is dead?

speaker: Ashe
text: That's what I've heard. But no one's found his body.

speaker: Ashe
text: If, somehow, he's still alive...I hope we'll meet again.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ya know, Professor, laying siege to a keep is like asking a girl out on a date. First, you get past her defenses...then you make your move.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's not the best analogy.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Trust me, I know what I'm talking about. I'm a seasoned veteran at this kind of thing. Girls, I mean . I've never actually, you know, captured any keeps...

speaker: Byleth
text: You might be right.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ha! I knew you'd get it, Professor.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Anyway, you know more about tactics than me, so I don't know why I'm offering you advice.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Oh, Goddess, hear my prayer. Please bless the deceased with peace everlasting... And may his soul rest in tranquility. You know, I used to see him praying quite often when I would come to the cathedral at night. I wonder who it was he prayed for back then...

speaker: Annette
text: Professor. They tell me my father died at Gronder. Was that... Was that really a fitting end for one such as him? I don't know. I just...don't know.

speaker: Ingrid
text: I only know what little I overheard. But what I did hear implied that the Empire was involved in the Tragedy of Duscur. If it's true, that may explain why His Highness chose to fight the Empire. Perhaps I should have fought alongside His Highness.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why is that?

speaker: Ingrid
text: Because...I too, lost someone to that tragedy--the most important person in my world.

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you having regrets?

speaker: Ingrid
text: No. Not anymore. I am where I belong.

speaker: Ingrid
text: Those of us still on this plane of existence will carry on the torch. The inhumane actions of the Empire must not be repeated.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Fort Merceus is old and strong. It's reputation for durability is equal to that of Arianrhod. Are you certain your plan is sufficient? It seems to be a little simplistic.

speaker: Byleth
text: Guess we'll find out.

speaker: Lorenz
text: That's not terrifically reassuring! Shouldn't you have more faith in your own plans?!

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll be fine.

speaker: Lorenz
text: I suppose I must take you at your word, mustn't I?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Incidentally, have you heard any news of Claude? I, for one, have a hard time believing he is dead. He was always a clever and tenacious sort.

speaker: Raphael
text: You know when you work your muscles and they start screaming? That means you gotta be nice to them. If you're muscles are hungry, you gotta feed them, and let them rest when they're tired.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't see how you'd do that.

speaker: Raphael
text: Whaddya mean, how? You just gotta eat and sleep! It's pretty obvious...

speaker: Byleth
text: You can tell how your muscles are feeling?

speaker: Raphael
text: Of course! If my muscles hurt, then I hurt. If they're hungry, well then I'm hungry too!

speaker: Raphael
text: What's with the confused face, Professor? You look like you don't get a word I'm saying!

speaker: Ignatz
text: It sounds like the battle at Gronder Field was pretty gruesome. We don't know for certain whether Claude's alive or dead. Maybe he's all right? I wish I could make sure somehow. But it doesn't seem possible now.

speaker: Lysithea
text: If Claude somehow survived, I imagine he's terribly wounded. All three forces have suffered heavy losses. We're incredibly lucky to have not been involved. This is a perfect and unique opportunity to go on the offense. Now is the time to prove ourselves, Professor.

speaker: Marianne
text: I never used to care whether I lived or died... But when I think of all those who died at Gronder, I realize how precious life truly is. I'm ashamed of how arrogant I was to think that death could mean so little...

speaker: Hilda
text: I like this idea of yours--dressing as Imperial soldiers so they'll let us in. But don't you wish there was one more twist in the plan? Come on, Professor, think! How could we add another wrinkle, hm?

speaker: Byleth
text: We can dress you as the emperor.

speaker: Hilda
text: Dress me as Edelgard?! But we look nothing alike!

speaker: Byleth
text: We could dress Seteth as a woman.

speaker: Hilda
text: Seteth, dressed as a woman? I don't understand what the point of that would be.

speaker: Hilda
text: On second thought, let's just stick to the plan as originally conceived. That seems safer.

speaker: Leonie
text: Under your leadership, we can win any battle, no matter the odds. That's what everyone's saying anyway. Hope you can keep up with our expectations, Professor.

speaker: Seteth
text: The battle at Gronder Field certainly took an unexpected turn, did it not? Let us press on, so as not to waste the opportunity. Fort Merceus is a keep that was constructed to defend the Imperial Capital, Enbarr. We cannot enter the capital without first capturing that fort. But once we have it, the city should be almost entirely at our mercy. I will make the necessary preparations. Be ready.

speaker: Flayn
text: Standing face to face with those whom I went to school with. On the field of battle... How inhuman war is--how horrifying. My heart feels shattered. It is my hope that this war marks the end of such foolish behavior.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Fort Merceus is the Empire's single most fortified military installation. Utterly impregnable, they say. I wonder, do you happen to know the nickname given to Fort Merceus?

speaker: Byleth
text: The Silver Maiden.

speaker: Hanneman
text: No, I'm afraid that name refers to the Fortress City of Arianrhod.

speaker: Byleth
text: Fódlan's Locket.

speaker: Hanneman
text: That one is a fortress that stands at Fódlan's Throat.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Stubborn Old General.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Indeed! A very good answer, but of course you'd know that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Seems Fódlans give everyone and everything a nickname. Why, you were called the Ashen Demon! Myself, I have been called the Father of Crestology, which is a nickname as well as a title, I suppose...

speaker: Manuela
text: Each step closer to Enbarr, I'm reminded of another part of my past. Riches and poverty, glory and failure, that city has it all. And if I'm honest...sometimes I miss it. That's how the past works though, isn't it? It's always a different story than what you really lived.

speaker: Alois
text: You're quite a tactician! Disguising ourselves as enemy soldiers to sneak in, undetected. A stroke of brilliance. In a frontal attack, our losses would be tremendous. With this strategy, we can really snatch victory from the jaws of...deceit!

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a good point.

speaker: Alois
text: Yes... With you leading our fighters, I've no doubt the Empire will suffer an embarrassing deceit. Get it? Deceit? Again?

speaker: Byleth
text: That's a bad pun.

speaker: Alois
text: Ah, rats! You've seen through my cunning punning!

speaker: Catherine
text: I hardly recognize everyone... Their faces have changed so much. More experience in the eyes, and more pain. I'm glad that they're stronger, but I hate to think they've all become hardened killers. Look after them, OK? Try to keep 'em on the straight-and-narrow.

speaker: Shamir
text: Did you give the ridiculous order to prepare Imperial armor for every one of our troops? I've reached out through all my channels, but there are limits to these things. I'll have to recruit an entire town's worth of people if I ever plan on making enough.

speaker: Cyril
text: Guess what I noticed. I can see further than most other people can see. But I can't figure the point of seeing further than an arrow can fly, since I can't shoot what I see.

speaker: Byleth
text: You could detect enemy movements in advance.

speaker: Cyril
text: I suppose I could see a whole horde of enemies coming and run away. That's kinda useful at least.

speaker: Byleth
text: You could find our targets quicker than anyone.

speaker: Cyril
text: Yeah, I suppose it could be real useful for finding Lady Rhea too.

speaker: Anna
text: A Class reunion on the battlefield? That's...bleak. That must've been so hard on everyone. You gotta keep looking after them all. I mean, they still look to you for guidance, you know?

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is it true that we'll be assaulting Fort Merceus next? That doesn't sound like the brightest idea... I've heard that it's built to withstand an attack from even the largest of armies! Not to tell you how to do your job, but don't do it! I'm not ready to say my final good-byes to everyone...

speaker: Seteth
text: We are just about to pass through Gronder Field. We should be in view of Fort Merceus soon. It looks like the battle made quite an impact... The Imperial Army has lost some of its luster. We should soon be able to invade the fort without too much trouble.

speaker: Byleth
text: Because of the Alliance and Kingdom's sacrifices...

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, we must win for them as well.

speaker: Byleth
text: We cannot let this opportunity pass us by.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, after a few short months, they will already be back on their feet. We cannot waste this opportunity.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Professor, the soldiers have finished changing into their disguises. We are ready to masquerade as Imperial troops and infiltrate the fort.

speaker: Byleth
text: Disguises?

speaker: Byleth
text: Infiltrate the fort?

speaker: Seteth
text: I believe this was your idea, was it not? It is impossible to take Fort Merceus with a frontal assault. We must take it from within. We will infiltrate the fort as Imperial troops and kill the enemy general. All preparations are complete.

speaker: Caspar
text: According to the scout reports, my father and the others are not inside the fort. It seems they were moved to the front lines of the Kingdom's western region.

speaker: Church Soldier
text: The Death Knight became the general of this fort after the battle at Gronder Field.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: What?! The Death Knight?! I think I'll be taking a break now... You guys go on ahead.

speaker: Petra
text: Bernadetta, you cannot be hiding on a field. The enemy will be seeing you.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: No place to hide?! I guess... I have no choice but to fight!

speaker: Seteth
text: The Death Knight... I hear that he is counted among the greatest heroes of the Empire at the moment. We never determined whether or not he was truly Jeritza. So in capturing Merceus, we have encountered another obstacle.

speaker: Byleth
text: We've beaten him before.

speaker: Seteth
text: I suppose you have a point. If we challenge him again with conviction, we are sure to attain victory.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's be careful.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, now more than ever.

speaker: Linhardt
text: The Impenetrable Fortress City of Arianrhod goes by the name Silver Maiden. Yet she pales in comparison to Fort Merceus--the Stubborn Old General. Those who approach are driven back, but once we make our way in, it's all ours.

speaker: Dorothea
text: That fort has been brought to life on stage for countless operas...

speaker: Seteth
text: Let us commence. We must puncture a hole in the Empire's defenses!

speaker: Death Knight
text: That man/woman approaches... Will death's scythe claim you... Or will I fall to that sword of yours...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Report! A group posing as Imperial soldiers has infiltrated! They seem to be affiliated with the church!

speaker: Death Knight
text: Close the gates. Leave no survivors.

speaker: Death Knight
text: The time is ripe.

speaker: Seteth
text: Do not let him get away! Circle around and cut off his retreat!

speaker: Death Knight
text: The time of ruin draws near... But their slaughter must wait until next we meet...

speaker: Seteth
text: He's fled, has he? Let us deal with the remaining foes and then make haste in our pursuit!

speaker: Death Knight
text: You. Leave.

speaker: Mercedes
text: No! I won't! I... I refuse to run from you anymore!

speaker: Flayn
text: So it's you, Death Knight! Remember me?!

speaker: Death Knight
text: You again. Here to lose more blood?

speaker: Flayn
text: Never! You will not lay a hand on me ever again

speaker: Seteth
text: You will not escape, Death Knight. Today you will be unmasked!

speaker: Death Knight
text: My true identity has no value.

speaker: Seteth
text: I will be the judge of that, once I've seen your face.

speaker: Death Knight
text: If you desire to slay me, follow. The appointed hour is at hand...

speaker: Death Knight
text: It is coming... Leave now or all of you will die.

speaker: Alliance Soldier In Imperial Gear
text: Run! We have to evacuate immediately!

speaker: Alliance Infantry Soldier
text: What just happened here?

speaker: Alliance Armoured Soldier
text: The fort, it's... It's just... gone.

speaker: Seteth
text: Whatever could that have been... It was almost reminiscent of that terror of legend...

speaker: Byleth
text: What legend?

speaker: Seteth
text: We haven't the time for stories...

speaker: Byleth
text: We need to get out of here.

speaker: Seteth
text: Agreed. We must retreat for now.

speaker: Seteth
text: All we can do is retreat to the Great Bridge of Myrddin and assess our situation.

speaker: Manuela
text: Well now, that marching was nearly as trying as the battle itself.

speaker: Hanneman
text: We wasted a few days, but now that we're this far back, we should be safe... Or so I believe.

speaker: Catherine
text: I still can't believe it. The fort was destroyed, just like that...

speaker: Shamir
text: The Death Knight knew about the attack. Was it the Empire's doing?

speaker: Cyril
text: Guess that means they'd rather destroy the fort than lose it.

speaker: Alois
text: Whatever the case, we need to get our bearings and decide what we're going to do next.

speaker: Seteth
text: We all have many questions, but for now, we must focus on our next move.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's give up.

speaker: Seteth
text: What?! How could... Ah. Yes, I see.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's attack the Imperial capital.

speaker: Seteth
text: I wish for that as well, but we are sure to fall if we charge in without a plan. Hmm... But by the look on your face, I have the feeling you are working out a plan even now.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's return to the monastery.

speaker: Seteth
text: What?! If we return to the monastery, then our situation is sure to... Ah. Yes, I see...

speaker: Byleth
text: Now you've got it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Whatever do you mean?

speaker: Seteth
text: No need to hide your intentions from me.

speaker: Seteth
text: So, we make it appear as though we have ceased our invasion by returning to Garreg Mach. Then we divide up our soldiers and infiltrate nearby areas of the capital right under the Empire's nose. Finally, we gather all of the soldiers somewhere we can get to swiftly from Garreg Mach and proceed to invade Enbarr. Is that what you are thinking?

speaker: Caspar
text: Are you serious? You know there's no guarantee that we won't be spotted by the enemy, right?

speaker: Ferdinand
text: If we fail to intervene, we will be isolated inside the Empire and be...utterly obliterated.

speaker: Petra
text: I will be embracing the nearness of death if I am needing to. With each other!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: That sounds dangerous...really, incredibly dangerous!

speaker: Seteth
text: Make no mistake...if we fail in this plan, there will be no coming back from it. Are you sure about this, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: It's our only hope.

speaker: Seteth
text: I see. If you are resolved, then I will follow suit. We may be weaker and the terrain may be against us, but all we can do is use our resources the best we can. That, and pray for the blessings of the goddess.

speaker: Alois
text: Ah, thank the goddess... I couldn't bear the thought of letting Jeralt down by not finding you.

speaker: Shamir
text: Guess you lucked out.

speaker: Catherine
text: We've been looking everywhere for you! But...I see Lady Rhea isn't with you. Damn.

speaker: Cyril
text: Everyone was real worried about you, Professor.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Seteth has told us everything. From here on out, you will have our aid.

speaker: Seteth
text: I am so grateful that everyone is safe. I am sorry things are moving so rapidly, but there is something we must discuss. Come with me.

speaker: Seteth
text: The time has come to make our true stand against the Empire.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's win, no matter what.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's all work together.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't feel confident, but we'll do our best.

speaker: Seteth
text: Our base will be Garreg Mach Monastery. The interior is in less than pristine condition, but we should be able to utilize it much the same as we had before.

speaker: Catherine
text: Surely those Imperial jerks have this place staked out, right? It's a highly strategic location.

speaker: Seteth
text: It may be an area of importance, but it is far removed from the front lines. Considering the burden of transport, it is possible they are not paying too much attention to it.

speaker: Shamir
text: Nothing escapes the emperor. There must be at least a spy or two.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, what do you think?

speaker: Byleth
text: I have no objections.

speaker: Flayn
text: I see! Then it must be the right idea!

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm worried about supplies.

speaker: Seteth
text: Your concern is valid. However...

speaker: Seteth
text: The town and surrounding hamlets are still present, and though far from abundant, the church still has funds at its disposal.

speaker: Flayn
text: That's true... Professor, I think we can leave expanding our army to my brother. He was always good at negotiating, and I believe he is best suited to the task.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: In that case, I have a request. Please allow my soldiers to join your ranks as well. House Aegir already tried taking on the emperor. As a result, our territory was stolen from us. As a consequence, I do not have many soldiers left to speak of. But those I have are yours to command.

speaker: Dorothea
text: I feel like I should tell you that I've been protecting some kids who lost their parents in the war. They're in the town right now, but maybe we can move them to the monastery? I'm sure they'd be happy to chip in however they can.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hm... Yes, I understand. I will make the necessary arrangements.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I nabbed some valuables from my house. Father is with the emperor now, so... It's not much, but it's yours.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I don't have a thing to contribute. In fact, I'm still in my same old clothes!

speaker: Caspar
text: I've been wandering on my own for five years. I won't go back to that house or my father, that's for sure!

speaker: Seteth
text: I understand. Leave it to me. No labor is too great if it means saving Fódlan...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: I have lost my dominion. My nobility may seem like nothing more that a title. But I will never lose my noble heart. I will stop Edelgard, even if it costs me my life. I have turned my blade against her now. I cannot go back on that decision. Professor... Do you think I chose the wrong path?

speaker: Byleth
text: Not at all.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: You are right...

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll find out soon enough.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: You are right...

speaker: Linhardt
text: The promise was made five years ago, but I must say I'm rather impressed by how many of us managed to make it. Personally, I only showed up because I hoped to see you again, Professor. I've been with my family in the Empire until recently. I admit to feeling a little guilty betraying Her Majesty...but only a little. Now that we're all together again, I suppose the fighting will begin soon.

speaker: Caspar
text: Hey, Professor! You won't believe what happened! I figured I couldn't go back to the Empire after Garreg Mach fell, so I started drifting across the Kingdom and the Alliance. Then I just happened to run into our old class, so we came back to the monastery together!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ah, at last, I return to my domain! My lonely paradise! My realm of exquisite solitude! Huh? Professor? Is that, um. Is that you? You, um. You didn't hear that just now, did you?

speaker: Byleth
text: Sorry.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Oh! Forget you heard anything!

speaker: Byleth
text: Hear what?

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Right. You didn't? Well, um. Good.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Laaa-la-laaa-la-laaa... Professor! Oh my! It's so good to see you. These days, so many old friends seem to be disappearing. But you... You're here! It's incredible to see you again after five years! I have a feeling your name will go down in history.

speaker: Petra
text: Edelgard is controlling the Empire. She is putting the pressure on the Kingdom and Alliance. Empire and religion are at open war. It will be...difficult for us at first. But corrupt nobles are many. That means that common people will rebel and be joining our side. With you, Professor, the battle tides will...ah, will turn. I have certainty.

speaker: Felix
text: A country with no king has no future. That's why I made my way here. Professor, don't let me down.

speaker: Byleth
text: Country with no king?

speaker: Felix
text: Hmph. You'll understand soon enough.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's forge ahead.

speaker: Felix
text: Yes, let's. Find me a worthy opponent to battle, and I'll be content.

speaker: Sylvain
text: I left home without telling my father. Did you know that? I can just imagine my father's face contorted in anger and the delightful words he must have used to describe me. Kind of a scary image, actually. But regardless, I've put my faith in you, Professor. And I'm hoping I haven't made a big mistake.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Hey, Professor. It's been a while. It's really good to see you again. Gorgeous as ever, might I add. An awful lot has happened in these past five years. There were so many times I wished you were around. I'm glad you're back. Your skills are worth more than a whole army.

speaker: Mercedes
text: You're here, Professor, along with everyone from our old class. It's like we've gone back in time! When I think that I'll be around you again, all of my sorrows just drift away.

speaker: Byleth
text: Frankly, I don't feel too happy.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm, I understand. Especially with Lady Rhea missing... It sounds like the Kingdom and Alliance have been in a sorry state too. But we can't let that get us down!

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's do our best together.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Hmm, yes. I'll at least try not to hold anyone back.

speaker: Mercedes
text: Let's work together for the common good, like we did five years ago!

speaker: Annette
text: Members of the knights tell me that Father left their ranks five years ago. They say he announced he was returning to the Kingdom, but nobody's heard from him since. I haven't received word that he went back home to Mother... Where could he be... Where are you, Father...

speaker: Ingrid
text: Professor, I have a proposal. Why not go beyond the Knights of Seiros--instead, uniting with allies from all across Fódlan to fight for our cause? Looking back, it would have been best to ally with the Kingdom and join forces against the Empire. But now the Kingdom is not exactly... Well...

speaker: Raphael
text: Fighting alongside you and everyone else is a dream come true, Professor! And don't worry about my little sis. Right now she's back home helping out with the family business. I kinda figured I was gonna be stuck going back and taking over for her. But thanks to you guys, I get to work on my dream of becoming a proper knight!

speaker: Ignatz
text: It's been fixed up quite a bit, but its battle scars aren't so easily erased... To think that a glorious cathedral, with a thousand year history...would end up like this. I'll rebuild this place someday. This cathedral is the symbol of Fódlan. Maybe I should paint a picture of the beautiful cathedral of old, while I still remember what it looked like...

speaker: Lysithea
text: I've grown weary and impatient--these past five years, my hands have been bound. But now, I can finally take action with a clear goal. I'm grateful to you and to everyone.

speaker: Byleth
text: I didn't do anything.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Nonsense. Your presence steeled everyone's resolve.

speaker: Byleth
text: And that goal is?

speaker: Lysithea
text: Down with the Empire! Surely peace will soon follow if the Empire is overthrown. Then my parents can finally find peace themselves.

speaker: Marianne
text: Even with the church in shambles, we can still pray. The goddess will surely hear our prayers, but still... I hope the church can return to its former beauty someday.

speaker: Hilda
text: Hey, Professor? I know that we didn't plan to stop at the monastery, but I'm glad we did. I'm happy to be here with everyone again.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're happy at a time like this?

speaker: Hilda
text: What good does grimness do us? Let's try to enjoy our time together while we still can.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm happy too.

speaker: Hilda
text: Right? It's as though we went back in time five years. I feel like my old self again.

speaker: Leonie
text: It's not just for my village that I'm fighting alongside you here, you know. It's also that Captain Jeralt asked me, his first and greatest apprentice, to look out for you. Of course, it wouldn't be enough just to keep you alive. It's my duty to make sure you win too. So, do your best, Professor. And count on me to watch your back.

speaker: Seteth
text: With the return of its knights, Garreg Mach is finally coming back to life. The Church of Seiros will follow you from now on, but please do not abandon the search for Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: We'll do whatever it takes to find her.

speaker: Seteth
text: Thank you. I know the battles ahead will be dire, but we will support you with all our strength.

speaker: Byleth
text: We don't know what the future will bring.

speaker: Seteth
text: Wherever she is, Rhea is doubtlessly waiting for you. Please do not let her down.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, I am so glad you are unharmed! No matter the path you walk, I will be with you every step of the way. Anything you ask of me, I shall see it through. You saved my life, and I am in your debt.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Thankfully, it appears the records and equipment I need for my research have not been damaged. I am most curious though. You say you were asleep for five whole years? Incredible. Perhaps this is another effect of your Crest. I do look forward to investigating you in greater detail.

speaker: Byleth
text: We can talk about that.

speaker: Hanneman
text: Wonderful news! I am most excited to begin. We must find the time, of course.

speaker: Byleth
text: Uh, maybe later...

speaker: Hanneman
text: I'll have to be content with observing you wherever you go, then. I cannot waste any opportunity!

speaker: Manuela
text: My, Professor. You haven't changed a bit! At your age, I'd expect your while demeanor to have changed greatly over five years... Though, I suppose I haven't changed either right? Thank you for noticing, by the way. Ah, just the two of us, forever young. Oh, let me have my fun.

speaker: Alois
text: I'd given up on ever seeing you again. Where have you been hiding? Anyway, now that we're reunited in the land of the living, I must fulfill my promise!

speaker: Byleth
text: What promise?

speaker: Alois
text: The promise I made to the captain, to keep you safe! I can't believe you've forgotten. How cold...

speaker: Byleth
text: Right, the promise.

speaker: Alois
text: That's right! I promised the captain I'd protect you in his stead, and now I'll make good on my word!

speaker: Catherine
text: In Lady Rhea's absence, I will follow you. That's what she would want me to do. Know that wherever you might lead us, I'll continue searching for Lady Rhea.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's fine.

speaker: Catherine
text: Good, because I will not budge on that point. Welcome back, Professor.

speaker: Byleth
text: Sounds like a lot of trouble.

speaker: Catherine
text: I don't care how much trouble it is! I will rescue Lady Rhea, at all costs.

speaker: Shamir
text: I'm more of a mercenary than a knight these days. I work to get paid. I never was too attached to Fódlan. I was considering leaving soon... But I might change my mind if you're around.

speaker: Cyril
text: I don't know anything about rebuilding, but I can sure do my best to clean up the mess. I'm gonna keep Lady Rhea's room spotless, so she can use it right away whenever she gets back. You gotta find her, Professor. You just gotta.

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! You know, it's such a thrill to be able to greet you like this again! I almost died in the battle five years ago, but I won't allow any enemies to get into this place again. I promise you that! even if the Death Knight shows up, I'll be sure to... Well, for now I'll keep training so I can eventually feel confident that I can stop him!

speaker: Seteth
text: Your attention, everyone. The Knights of Seiros and our most trusted allies have gathered. We have rallied our troops for the purpose of stopping the Adrestian Empire's efforts to rule all. We have prepared a new flag to fight under...

speaker: Seteth
text: Much like the professor, it bears the Crest of Flames. I hope everyone finds this suitable. Beneath this flag, we will bring back peace to the great land of Fódlan!

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor, I'm not sure I understand... Why is the Empire intent on making an enemy of the church?

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't understand either.

speaker: Flayn
text: Quite perplexing... If the church disappears from Fódlan, I wonder if the Empire thinks it will benefit them in some way? I feel, I feel that it will only confuse the people.

speaker: Byleth
text: They must oppose the way of the church.

speaker: Flayn
text: What is meant by the way of the church? What do they dislike about it?

speaker: Seteth
text: I have no idea what Edelgard was thinking or how she arrived at the decision to raise an army. However, I do have some small insight as to what she is after. She is attempting to destroy the existing social order. That is why the Church of Seiros is first on the list of institutions that must be destroyed. It may very well be her goal to rebuild Fódlan from the ground up...

speaker: Flayn
text: I see... But that is only Edelgard's desire, is it not? I cannot imagine that the people of Fódlan would want that for themselves. She may have high ideals, but she certainly lacks any compunction about throwing the world, and its people, into an awful war... It just seems so illogical!

speaker: Seteth
text: You have a point, Flayn. I do not believe the people will ever understand her aim. So long as she makes the people suffer, our Knights of Seiros will fight on and strive to protect them. If we do not defeat Edelgard and retake control of this world, Fódlan's future shall be as dark as night.

speaker: Flayn
text: Thank you, dear Brother. I finally feel I understand what is going on.

speaker: Seteth
text: I am always happy to answer your questions, Flayn. Is there anything else you wish to ask?

speaker: Flayn
text: Well, um... Actually, I have a question for the professor. My brother mentioned that...you slumbered for five years. Where was it that you slept?

speaker: Byleth
text: At the bottom of a valley.

speaker: Flayn
text: The bottom of a valley? In the water? That certainly sounds frigid! I would never choose such a place myself. I am surprised you did not fall ill.

speaker: Byleth
text: Under a rock.

speaker: Flayn
text: Under a rock... How similar we are! As it were, I took my rest in a casket made of stone.

speaker: Flayn
text: Oh. Well, I suppose one's first long slumber is difficult to recall...

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Pardon the intrusion, but we must prepare a counterattack! Now! It seems the Imperial Army found out about us entering the monastery!

speaker: Seteth
text: Hm. That is sooner than expected. They must have been spying on us...

speaker: Flayn
text: I wonder if we can win on our own...

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: There aren't many of them... It looks like we'll just be facing the ones who were stationed nearby.

speaker: Seteth
text: Did they move on us too soon? Perhaps if we fight by using the land to our advantage...

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's proceed carefully.

speaker: Seteth
text: Of course. If we are careful, we will not lose.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's destroy them.

speaker: Flayn
text: Yes, I agree. Let us take them out in one fell swoop!

speaker: Seteth
text: Never again will those Imperial scoundrels disgrace Garreg Mach with their presence! Onward, Professor!

speaker: Randolph
text: The Knights of Seiros are a powerful enemy, but we have more soldiers. We'll take them down all at once!

speaker: Seteth
text: Clever tactics are our only hope here. We will use fire to deal with the main enemy force.

speaker: Knight Of Seiros
text: Report! The enemy has entered the periphery of Garreg Mach!

speaker: Seteth
text: If we allow them to take the interior, the monastery will be lost. We must drive them back!

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: What? That strange battle flag is... But isn't our enemy the Church of Seiros?

speaker: Randolph
text: They didn't have enough soldiers with just the church, so they upped their numbers by joining with those filthy rogues. It doesn't matter what flag they fly. They're nothing more than a mob. We'll destroy them all!

speaker: Seteth
text: Our troops are preparing the attack. Protect them until they reach their destination!

speaker: Seteth
text: Ugh... To think we'd let Garreg Mach fall twice to these rebels...

speaker: Randolph
text: A total loss... But we can't just return home like this...

speaker: Seteth
text: Watch out, Professor! They're coming for you!

speaker: Victory Conditions
text: Defeat the enemy commander.

speaker: Seteth
text: Our fire unit was destroyed. The plan has failed...

speaker: Randolph
text: It looks like they were planning something, but it failed!

speaker: Seteth
text: All is prepared. Now we just need to draw the enemy's attention. Traitors! Repent of your sins and the goddess may yet show you mercy!

speaker: Randolph
text: Quiet! Don't think you'll get away with mocking me! Attack! Make sure they never speak again!

speaker: Seteth
text: Now! Begin!

speaker: Imperial Soldier 1
text: Fire! Gyaaaaaah!

speaker: Imperial Soldier 2
text: It burns! Save me!

speaker: Randolph
text: Argh, a fire attack... The damage is too great. We can't fight anymore! All units, retreat! I'll take on our pursuers! Carry away the injured soldiers!

speaker: Seteth
text: Press the attack! Give them no quarter!

speaker: Seteth
text: We drove back the Imperial army. The real fight has only just begun...

speaker: Caspar
text: I never thought I'd be fighting Randolph... I guess it can't be helped, seeing as how I've left my own territory and all. But...what will I do if my father or brother get involved. I really don't want to face them...

speaker: Byleth
text: We must stay strong.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Too true, Professor. So long as the Empire is our enemy, we cannot avoid fighting those we are acquainted with. Though I suppose I have it easier since my house is no longer on the Empire's side.

speaker: Dorothea
text: My friends from the opera said they would leave the capital and go west... So, at least I won't be seeing them in battle.

speaker: Linhardt
text: Hmm, I don't think I care if my own house falls. Let's make it a grand fight...after a grand nap of course...

speaker: Petra
text: It does not give me happiness to have the people of Brigid involved...but it is not the time to be thinking of that. If it is a possibility, I will be having their strength.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: I don't mind at all. Really! I have no friends anyway, and my father hasn't done much to make me care for him. Not that he'd ever step on a battlefield anyway! Oh, but I do wonder how Mother is doing...

speaker: Seteth
text: Each of our situations is unique. What we share is companionship and the will to fight as one. Professor, you are the heart of our efforts. We will support you as best we can.

speaker: Seteth
text: I have a proposal. It would be most difficult to fight the Imperial army with the forces we have now. As such, I believe we should send messengers to whatever lords we can trust in the Kingdom and the Alliance so that we may gain their support. Do you agree?

speaker: Byleth
text: I agree.

speaker: Seteth
text: It is heartening to hear you say that.

speaker: Byleth
text: It concerns me.

speaker: Seteth
text: It is difficult to know who we can trust, of course. But we cannot just stand idle either.

speaker: Seteth
text: If all we do is bide our time, out enemy's main army will come down upon us like a hammer from above.

speaker: Shamir
text: Who are you planning to ask?

speaker: Catherine
text: Sadly, House Charon is out. We can trust them, but they have no help to offer.

speaker: Alois
text: Hm, how about House Daphnel of the Alliance? Their leader is sure to at least respond.

speaker: Flayn
text: Oh, how about House Daphnel of the Alliance? I recall that their leader was quite exceptional.

speaker: Seteth
text: Judith, the Hero of Daphnel... Yes, that is a fine suggestion. That territory is on the border of the Kingdom and the Alliance. It has not yet been claimed by the fires of war. If they agree to lend us their troops, out forces will be greatly strengthened. We shall send along a secret messenger at once.

speaker: Seteth
text: Everyone. It is probable that Rhea is within the castle walls. We must defeat Edelgard and rescue Rhea in one fell swoop, no matter what stands in our way.

speaker: Byleth
text: I don't want to kill Edelgard.

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps we can walk the same path as Edelgard...

speaker: Seteth
text: She is one of your students. I understand your desire for a path to peace. But she will never bend to our will. You do understand that, do you not? We have no choice but to kill her.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: We have already killed Hubert. Now is no time to hesitate.

speaker: Caspar
text: She has it coming! After all, she started this war!

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Someone has to stop her, and that someone is us!

speaker: Linhardt
text: As her former classmates, I feel we owe it to her to try talking it out.

speaker: Petra
text: This battle will be a deciding one. I am believing that it is her wish to be facing us.

speaker: Dorothea
text: Poor Edie... Professor, wherever you lead, I'll follow.

speaker: Cyril
text: I... I'll fight with all I got to save Lady Rhea!

speaker: Alois
text: In the name of the Knights of Seiros, we'll bring the hammer down on the Imperial army!

speaker: Flayn
text: The lives of Lady Rhea and everyone here are more important than all else. I shall be prepared.

speaker: Seteth
text: I leave this mission in your hands. Say the word, and we shall begin!

speaker: Edelgard
text: They've made it into the palace, but it's actually the perfect chance to turn the tables on them. Defeating them all will turn the tide of the war instantly. Taking a risk on dragging us back from the brink is the only option. Everyone! Prepare for a bitter struggle! Victory to the Adrestian Empire!

speaker: Seteth
text: The throne room is tightly locked. But wherever there are locks, there are also keys.

speaker: Dedue
text: So close... Must press on...

speaker: Imperial Soldier
text: Infiltrators! Kill them!

speaker: Edelgard
text: I must confess I never imagined that you would be able to pursue me this far. I don't mean to belittle your skills, Professor, but you've far surpassed my expectations.

speaker: Seteth
text: Block off the stairwells! Stop their reinforcements from getting through!

speaker: Seteth
text: Well done! Their reinforcements are cut off.

speaker: Edelgard
text: Clever tactic. It's going to be difficult to turn the tables now.

speaker: Seteth
text: At last, it is over... Now we must find Rhea.

speaker: Flayn
text: Professor! Brother! I have a letter. The Imperial general asked me to deliver this to my instructor.

speaker: Seteth
text: Who is it from? Hurry up, Professor. Read it at once.

speaker: Ferdinand
text: It is from...Hubert? Though he has left this world, he is reaching out through this letter...

speaker: Hubert
text: If you are reading this letter, that means I have perished. As Her Majesty would never surrender to another, I can only assume she has fallen as well. It greatly pains me to think of this coming to pass... That said, as the survivors, I must ask you to settle certain affairs in our stead. You must destroy the threat that slithers in the dark. I am sure you must recall Monica and Tomas.

speaker: Seteth
text: What Hubert has written here... I cannot... No, I know it must be true. And if that is the case, then all else makes sense now. I must speak with Rhea. It seems our battle is not over just yet. Those who slither in the dark... We must kill every last one of them, or Fódlan will never again know peace.

speaker: Flayn
text: They are allies of Monica and Tomas... Correct? The ones who were after my blood. And also the ones who destroyed Fort Merceus with that mysterious light...

speaker: Seteth
text: We shall discuss this more after we have rescued Rhea.

speaker: Rhea
text: You... You have come to save me... Is this... Is this a dream? I have longed to see you again... all this time... Is it truly you?

speaker: Rhea
text: Seteth, Flayn... You are here as well... Thank you for supporting the professor, and for rescuing me.

speaker: Seteth
text: Rhea... I am overjoyed that you are unharmed. I could not stand losing another of our kind.

speaker: Rhea
text: Yes... I am reminded of the past... of reuniting in Enbarr...

speaker: Seteth
text: It is truly nostalgic. I would love nothing more than to lose ourselves in memories of the old days, but... I must tell you something, Rhea. We have received incredible news, albeit from the Empire. They have told us the identity of our enemy. Those who slither in the dark... It is time for us to stop hiding the truth about the goddess—the progenitor god. The truth about us. It is time for us to tell the people everything.

speaker: Rhea
text: Those who slither in the dark...

speaker: Flayn
text: We are told they despise the children of the goddess, as well as those who live above ground. They are planning something horrible.

speaker: Seteth
text: Please, tell the professor everything about these vile people. There must be things that only you know.

speaker: Rhea
text: I understand. Dear child... I will now tell you all that I know. It is true that there is a group of people who have slithered in the darkness and threatened the peace of Fódlan since ancient times. I am sure you have heard the stories of a man named Nemesis...

speaker: Byleth
text: The King of Liberation...

speaker: Byleth
text: The wielder of the Sword of the Creator...

speaker: Seteth
text: Nemesis, the King of Liberation... The man who received the Sword of the Creator from the goddess and became a hero. However...

speaker: Rhea
text: Nemesis was originally the leader of a group of bandits. He plundered the Holy Tomb and stole the remains of the progenitor god. When Nemesis appeared in Zanado some time later, he already wielded the Sword of the Creator.

speaker: Byleth
text: In Zanado?

speaker: Seteth
text: The Red Canyon. We journeyed there five years ago. Do you recall?

speaker: Byleth
text: How did he get the Sword of the Creator?

speaker: Rhea
text: The legend that the goddess gifted him the sword so that he could fight the wicked gods...is false. That story was created after the fact.

speaker: Rhea
text: I do not know how Nemesis obtained the sword, or why he appeared in Zanado. But he used that sword to massacre the people there. The children of the progenitor god. From their corpses he gained even more power, and brought war to Fódlan... A mere bandit like Nemesis would not have been capable of anything so monstrous on his own...

speaker: Seteth
text: It was surmised that someone was collaborating with Nemesis, and there was a massive investigation to uncover who it was. But the truth was never discovered. I am now certain that his accomplices were Those who slither in the dark. And this time, they have utilized the imperial army to send Fódlan back into the flames of war...

speaker: Flayn
text: So, Edelgard has made a temporary alliance with them in order to achieve her own aims... Professor, we must journey to Shambhala and stop them!

speaker: Rhea
text: You must not allow Fódlan's bloody history... the Red Canyon Tragedy... to repeat itself...

speaker: Seteth
text: Ah, it's you.

speaker: Flayn
text: We were just talking about Rhea...

speaker: Seteth
text: We have searched for five long years but have not found a trace of her. It is possible that she is sleeping somewhere... Just as you were sleeping all those years.

speaker: Byleth
text: Is that what you think?

speaker: Seteth
text: That is my current theory, yes.

speaker: Byleth
text: Perhaps.

speaker: Flayn
text: Do you think so? I truly hope that is the case.

speaker: Seteth
text: We have moved against the Empire with the intent of defeating them, but have not given up hope of recovering Rhea. If she is alive, we will find her. Rhea is like family to us...and to you, as well. Please, lend me your strength...

speaker: Seteth
text: The messenger we sent to Daphnel returned with a reply. Please, read it at once.

speaker: Judith
text: I understand your situation. I will help you with whatever strength I have to spare. But there is a problem. Openly marshaling soldiers within my territory could provoke other members of the Alliance. Therefore, I will secretly gather troops in Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Will your group be able to receive the soldiers in this location? From there, it should be safe to return to the monastery by following the border between the Alliance and the Kingdom.

speaker: Byleth
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment...

speaker: Seteth
text: Ailell is a deep valley located on the border of the Kingdom and the Alliance. People stay far away. There, we can meet without anyone finding out. It is decided. Make plans to meet up with our reinforcements at once.

speaker: Church Soldier
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torrment...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Some day we will take the Imperial capital. It is odd to think that I will be invading the very city that I once called home. Ah, that is still a ways off. I will prepare for our journey to Ailell.

speaker: Linhardt
text: I never do get used to the sight of blood. It always makes me feel as if I might faint. I suppose I've told you that though, yes? I've no idea how you cope with it. I hope this war ends soon. I dislike being lightheaded because other people are bleeding everywhere. Though the thought of working hard for it does sound like quite a pain...

speaker: Caspar
text: I didn't think we'd end up fighting Randolph... He's my uncle. Well, not by blood, so... I guess I can handle it.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm still worried about you.

speaker: Caspar
text: Don't worry about me. I'm ready for anything.

speaker: Byleth
text: You're very resolute.

speaker: Caspar
text: Don't worry about me. I'm ready for anything.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment? What kind of a name for a place is that? It sounds scary. Do I really have to go with you? Hey, um, here's an idea... Maybe let the recluse stay home and hold the fort!

speaker: Dorothea
text: Hey, Professor, thanks for your hard work again! Nothing to report today! Was I convincing? Was it like he was standing right in front of you? Some things are the same as they were five years ago, but I guess a lot more has changed...

speaker: Petra
text: Since the past, I have learned much of the language of Fódlan. But speaking the Fódlan language still gives me difficulty. I can understand, read, and write with nearly perfection now. But understanding and speaking are...fruits of a different color.

speaker: Byleth
text: That's part of your charm.

speaker: Petra
text: I have gratitude for you, Professor. I hope that I will have fluency one day.

speaker: Byleth
text: Everyone has a weak spot.

speaker: Petra
text: Yes. I will keep practicing more.

speaker: Felix
text: Some in Faerghus believe Dimitri is still alive. My father is one such eccentric. Hmph, they can't accept reality. Dimitri is dead. He's not coming back.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Aw, man... I really do not want to go there.

speaker: Byleth
text: Pull yourself together.

speaker: Sylvain
text: Professor, have you ever been to Ailell? If you had, you'd know. That place is crazy hot! For guys like me who grew up somewhere cold? Man... It's gonna be rough. Though, I guess that climate will keep our enemies at bay.

speaker: Byleth
text: Why not?

speaker: Sylvain
text: That place is crazy hot! For guys like me who grew up somewhere cold? Man... It's gonna be rough. Though, I guess that climate will keep our enemies at bay.

speaker: Mercedes
text: We may not be students anymore, but it's still important to read. We might even learn something that's useful for our next battle.

speaker: Byleth
text: Studying is important.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I couldn't agree more! I hope the Officers Academy reopens when the war is over.

speaker: Byleth
text: Training is important too.

speaker: Mercedes
text: I suppose that may be true. I always try my best at both.

speaker: Mercedes
text: It's a shame the monastery was ruined, but... At least the books are still intact!

speaker: Annette
text: Professor, is it really OK to rely on Judith? I hear there are still quarrels within the Alliance... This generous offer of soldiers and supplies seems a little too good to be true. I mean, it's also really impressive, but I'm just a little worried, I suppose...

speaker: Ingrid
text: My family, the Galateas, are an offshoot of the Daphnel family. The family split in half when two brothers quarreled over an inheritance. Despite blood relations, the families lived apart from one another, so the relationship has been distant and somewhat estranged. I'm not so much acquainted with Judith, the head of House Daphnel.

speaker: Raphael
text: Sharing her food with us for nothing in return? Judith really is a great person! She's more like a goddess than the goddess is!

speaker: Byleth
text: She is very much like a goddess.

speaker: Raphael
text: I never met her, so I don't know for sure, but she must be beautiful and kind.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm not sure about that.

speaker: Raphael
text: No? Well, she can be a demon for all I care, so long as she feeds me!

speaker: Ignatz
text: The Valley of Torment... I'd heard of it, but I never expected to go there. It's exciting! I wonder what the landscape is like.

speaker: Byleth
text: It sounds dangerous.

speaker: Ignatz
text: It probably is dangerous, but I still want to get there and see it as soon as I can.

speaker: Byleth
text: It sounds painful.

speaker: Ignatz
text: Hmm, that is an interesting point... The name does seem to suggest that.

speaker: Lysithea
text: Ailell, the Valley of Torment, lies on the border of three noble territories. The Kingdom's Fraldarius and Galatea families, and the Alliance's Daphnel family. In the Fraldarius lands to the north, the former Kingdom army and new duke's army are fighting.

speaker: Marianne
text: Valley of Torment... Valley of Torment...

speaker: Byleth
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Marianne
text: I once read a book full of legends surrounding Ailell, but I can't seem to remember...

speaker: Byleth
text: Are you chanting some sort of curse?

speaker: Marianne
text: N-no... I'm trying to remember the legends surrounding Ailell...

speaker: Hilda
text: My big brother told me stories of Judith's bravery. With just one look, she tamed a runaway horse that nobody else had been able to touch. When an Almyran general provoked her, she talked him into a tearful apology. She's spectacular. I wish she'd fight alongside us.

speaker: Leonie
text: You're not a teacher anymore, and we're not your students, but everyone still calls you Professor. Is there something you'd rather be called?

speaker: Byleth
text: Professor is fine.

speaker: Leonie
text: Guess that's what we're used to, huh? All right.

speaker: Byleth
text: Call me by my name.

speaker: Leonie
text: Oh? All right, then. I'll call you--ugh. Nope! Sorry, can't do it. Too weird.

speaker: Seteth
text: Meeting reinforcements in the Valley of Torment seems like an astute decision to me. In that land of oppressive heat, it is unlikely that we will be disturbed. It also means we will contend with those harsh conditions ourselves, however. Best ensure we are well prepared.

speaker: Flayn
text: It has been only five years, yet so much has changed. Half of the Kingdom has fallen to the Empire, Skirmishes are rife throughout the Alliance. Despite such tumult, we look upon the same sky, unchanged by the storm happening beneath it.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you wish you could return to those days?

speaker: Flayn
text: Yes, it would be nice, I suppose. Things were... simpler then. Or so they seemed to be, at the time.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's true--it's just like it was all those years ago.

speaker: Flayn
text: Indeed. I gazed up at this same sky with Mother and Father. It does not feel so long ago at all. Wait, but how would you know, Professor?

speaker: Hanneman
text: The monastery repairs have made solid progress. Most excellent news. When we first returned here, I was unsure what we were going to do with the ruins of this place... But if we can get the cathedral rebuilt, we'll have it looking just like old times soon enough.

speaker: Manuela
text: Hearing that an old student has died cuts me right to the heart... As this war with the Empire continues, we'll see more of it, Professor. We have a duty to fight alongside our students. We taught them how to fight, after all. Now, let's help them win!

speaker: Alois
text: Even though we're getting reinforcements, we should still be prepared for the worst. Never shirk your training, no matter what. To practice, I'm going to chop something up with my sword. Unless you'd like to train together! Care to spar?

speaker: Catherine
text: I've heard people talk about the Hero of Daphnel. If the stories of her courage are true, no one will be able to stand against us. In different circumstances, I'd have wanted to try crossing swords with her. Right now, we have to focus on getting those reinforcements. Let's hope nothing goes wrong.

speaker: Shamir
text: There are enemy spies around. Remain vigilant. Capture anyone who seems suspicious.

speaker: Byleth
text: To kill them?

speaker: Shamir
text: What else would we do with them?

speaker: Byleth
text: All right, I will.

speaker: Shamir
text: I'm glad you understand. I'm counting on you.

speaker: Cyril
text: Gotta clean out the storerooms, tend the flowers, do the washing, dust the library...

speaker: Byleth
text: That sounds like a lot of work.

speaker: Cyril
text: Well, it's my job, ya know? Gotta do your job.

speaker: Byleth
text: Do you need any help?

speaker: Cyril
text: Nah, this is my job. Lady Rhea herself gave it to me. Even if Lady Rhea's not here right now, I still gotta do my duty.

speaker: Cyril
text: Like you. You gotta have other stuff you oughta be doing, yeah?

speaker: Anna
text: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

speaker: Gatekeeper
text: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is everyone setting out on a big campaign? Not exactly? Ah, so you're meeting up with the reinforcements. Well, you can leave guarding this place to me! I'll keep an eye out for anything suspicious!

speaker: Linhardt
text: I'm overheated and have changed my mind. I'd like to return to my cozy bed now.

speaker: Bernadetta
text: Who knew somewhere so hot existed in Fódlan. I wonder if it's OK to walk everywhere...

speaker: Ferdinand
text: Just use the superior emotional fortitude of nobility. And, well...be very careful.

speaker: Seteth
text: It is said that this land was born of the goddess's wrath. There was an immense battle here long ago. To end it, she set the entire valley aflame. Of course, there is no record of this. Some theorize this was done by another and then blamed on the goddess...

speaker: Petra
text: My head is being defeated by this heat. I think I am seeing visions... There, within the mountains... A shadow...

speaker: Caspar
text: That's just the-- Whoa. I see it too.

speaker: Seteth
text: It appears to be a military force...but in a different location than the one we agreed to.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's an enemy raid.

speaker: Seteth
text: They are dressed like Kingdom soldiers... They fooled us!

speaker: Byleth
text: They might be allies.

speaker: Seteth
text: Hold a moment... They are dressed like Kingdom soldiers! Is this an ambush?

speaker: Shamir
text: Damn... I thought we had disposed of all the spies.

speaker: Catherine
text: They carry the flag of House Rowe... They've joined the Empire, then. To think they'd travel all this way.

speaker: Seteth
text: Are you ready to confront them, Professor?

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm worried about Judith.

speaker: Seteth
text: As am I. We have no reason to believe she was intercepted en route, but we must act quickly. Let us take them down and locate Judith's army!

speaker: Byleth
text: We must break through.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, we must defeat them quickly and locate Judith's army.

speaker: Seteth
text: They have chosen the Valley of Torment for this battle, and so we shall send them to the flames of eternity!

speaker: Gwendal
text: The Valley of Torment... Perhaps a good place to finish off my life as a knight. Only if that puny force of children is able to kill me, of course...

speaker: Seteth
text: That lion banner--it seems Gwendal is the one leading the troops of House Rowe. He is an experienced general, renowned throughout Faerghus. Let us hold nothing back.

speaker: Seteth
text: This is Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Expect this smoke and fire to assail us at every turn. Touching the flames of torment will get you worse than a scorching. Proceed carefully.

speaker: Gwendal
text: The Crest of Flames? Ha! Quite full of themselves, aren't they?

speaker: Ashe
text: Just as I thought--the professor's army. But it's too late to back out now. In Lonato's place, I have to do my duty.

speaker: Kingdom Soldier
text: Here we go! Attack them from both sides!

speaker: Judith
text: Oh, old Gwendal is here. And he doesn't look to be an ally...

speaker: Gwendal
text: Oh, the Hero of Daphnel is here! I'll expect more from her than the young ones...

speaker: Defeat Conditions
text: All of your units fall in battle, or Judith is defeated.

speaker: Judith
text: You... No, let's leave the pleasantries for later. First, I want you to take this. It's nothing important, but it may prove useful.

speaker: Ashe
text: Forgive me... But as Lonato's son, I have a duty!

speaker: Ashe
text: I don't want to fight you, Professor... But this is how it has to be. There's no turning back.

speaker: Ashe
text: I know this is it, but... I don't want to die...

speaker: Ashe
text: You want to spare me? Why? I'll... I'll do it. I'll join your side. Let me fight for you.

speaker: Gwendal
text: Does a whelp like you really expect to kill me? I am Gwendal, the Gray Lion, a knight by the hand of Count Rowe! Do your worst!

speaker: Gwendal
text: Ah, so I have found a place to die... Young ones... I thank you...

speaker: Seteth
text: That was quite a predicament. But now we can see to the objective we had in mind.

speaker: Judith
text: To think we'd get into a scrap here of all places. We're lucky we all made it out alive.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm sorry for involving you in this.

speaker: Judith
text: Don't worry about it. In this day and age, it's a miracle I've been unscathed this long.

speaker: Byleth
text: I see why they call you a hero.

speaker: Judith
text: Well, that's ancient history.

speaker: Judith
text: So you're that professor everyone talks about. You're just as Claude described.

speaker: Byleth
text: Claude?

speaker: Judith
text: He asked me to help you because you seemed trustworthy.

speaker: Byleth
text: That professor everyone talks about?

speaker: Judith
text: You used to teach at the Officers Academy five years back, right? I guess you didn't teach Claude, though. He asked me to help you because you seemed trustworthy.

speaker: Seteth
text: Claude of the Alliance? How did he learn of our plans? We can't underestimate someone like him... There is a reason they call him the Master Tactician. But I suppose we are both fighting against the Empire now. The enemy of our enemy is our ally.

speaker: Judith
text: That's right. I have a letter from him as well.

speaker: Judith
text: It's up to you to decide how to use it.

speaker: Seteth
text: That is yours, Professor. Please tell me what it says when you see fit.

speaker: Judith
text: OK, let's wrap up this hand-off of soldiers. Not that I suspect you of anything, but... I must warn you that these are very important soldiers for my territory. Don't treat them like expendable equipment.

speaker: Judith
text: Oh. By the way, I have some important information. A witness saw Lady Rhea being dragged off by the Imperial Army after the battle five years ago.

speaker: Alois
text: Are you sure your source is reliable?

speaker: Judith
text: One of my own saw it happen. I'm certain.

speaker: Alois
text: It seems we chose wisely when decided to fight against the Empire.

speaker: Seteth
text: Thank you for the information. We will rescue her at all costs.

speaker: Seteth
text: Now that we have reinforcements, it is time to advance against the Empire. And yet, we do not have enough troops to face our enemy's main army head-on. We have no choice but to use our small numbers wisely by taking over key locations as we blaze our way to the Imperial capital.

speaker: Byleth
text: It's an easy win.

speaker: Seteth
text: Do not indulge in being overly optimistic. It would be our ruin.

speaker: Byleth
text: It will be a fierce fight.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, it will. We must brace ourselves.

speaker: Seteth
text: As you know, the Oghma Mountains lie south of Garreg Mach, towards the Empire. In order to enter Empire territory, we must travel around those mountains. There are two possible routes--through the Kingdom to the west, and through the Alliance to the east.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go west.

speaker: Seteth
text: The western half of the Kingdom is under the Empire's control. It may be too dangerous to pass through there. I suggest we take the eastern route, for safety.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's go east.

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, that makes sense.

speaker: Seteth
text: There are lords in the Alliance who support the Empire, but they are, at least, not completely under their control. Furthermore, you hold a key to the Empire within your grasp.

speaker: Byleth
text: Claude's letter?

speaker: Seteth
text: Yes, precisely.

speaker: Byleth
text: The Sword of the Creator?

speaker: Byleth
text: My charm?

speaker: Seteth
text: This is no time for tomfoolery. I am referring to the letter from Claude.

speaker: Claude
text: Hey there, Teach. It's been a while, hasn't it? I never dared to imagine you might still be alive. Wonders never cease! I don't know exactly why, but I feel that I can trust you. So I'm going to do just that. To that end, I propose an exchange. You're intending to invade the Empire. That much is clear. And that means your only option is to pass through the east. You'll have to cross the Airmid River, which runs along the border between the Empire and the Alliance. That means you'll need to gain control of the Great Bridge of Myrddin, the one closest to Garreg Mach. It just so happens that my family, House Riegan, is in conflict with House Gloucester right now. It would be easy enough for us to eliminate them, but I would prefer that we settle things without it coming to that. Do you see where I'm going with this? We'll act as a distraction and draw House Gloucester away from there. That will allow you to cross through their territory and take the Great Bridge of Myrddin. After you take the bridge from the Imperial army, House Gloucester won't be able to receive their aid. You'll get to cross Myrddin without any trouble, and I'll be able to maintain stability in the Alliance. Not a bad deal, eh? I hope to hear from you soon. Be well, Teach.

speaker: Seteth
text: The Master Tactician, indeed. Somehow he is already aware of our plan. The conditions are not bad... All is he says it is. If we take the Great Bridge of Myrddin, and House Gloucester bows down to House Riegan... The route from the monastery to the Empire will be much safer for our forces.

speaker: Byleth
text: Let's do it.

speaker: Seteth
text: It seems you are decided. We will send our answer at once.

speaker: Byleth
text: I'm suspicious.

speaker: Seteth
text: I am afraid we have no choice, considering the circumstances...
